He gave him the note, so he [the man] went with it to him [Umar bin Harun] and asked him about the hadith of Yahya bin Abi Amr. He said: 'I did not hear from Abd al-Malik; rather So-and-so narrated it to me from Abd al-Malik.' So he came to Ibn Mahdi and informed him, so he [Ibn Mahdi] attacked [him].

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...from him, and he spoke. Abu Abd Allah said: Most of what he narrated to us was from Ibn Jurayj, and he narrates from Al-Awza'i. It was said to him: Do you narrate from him? He said: I had narrated something from him. 42 - He said: A man came here and narrated to them a hadith from Sufyan, so they threw it [presented it] to Abd al-Rahman. He said: This is a lie; this is nothing [has no basis]. So they denied it from him [the narrator] and sought help from Waki'. So they wrote to him, and behold, the hadith was Batil [false]. 43 - It was said to him: Is Ubaid Allah more established or Malik regarding Nafi'? He said: No one is more established regarding Nafi' than Ubaid Allah. 44 - He was asked about Uqail and Yunus. He said: Uqail. And that is...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...because Yunus perhaps raised something from the opinion of Al-Zuhri, making it from Ibn Al-Musayyib. And he said: Yunus has narrated from Uqail. 45 - Abu Abd Allah was asked about Shu'aib. He said: There is none among them but that he is Trustworthy (Thiqah). And he began saying: Do you know who is the Thiqah? The Thiqah is Yahya Al-Qattan. Do you know who is the Hujjah (Proof/Authority)? Shu'bah; and Sufyan is a Hujjah, and Malik is a Hujjah. I said: And Yahya? He said: Yahya, Abd al-Rahman, and Abu Nu'aim are the Hujjah. The Thabt (Established)...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Abu Nu'aim was a Thabt. 46 - He mentioned Abdah bin Sulaiman and said: He was among the best of Muslims. He was a [source of] narration from Sa'id. We came, and he had a young boy to whom he was narrating. He would say to the boy: "Read to me." If he [the boy] made a mistake, Abdah would say to him: "Repeat it so I can dictate to you." 47 - He said: Ibn Bishr had a good book from Sa'id; their hearing was early. I said: Did Sa'id become confused [due to age]? He said: Yes.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: As for Yahya, he used to say: Whoever heard before the year forty-five [145 AH]. As for Abd al-Wahhab, he was confused/mixed up, meaning before his hearing. 48 - I said: Is Abd al-Wahhab Trustworthy? He said: Do you know who is the Thiqah? The Thiqah is Yahya Al-Qattan. 49 - I asked him about Khilas. He said: What he narrated from other than Ali, he saw no harm in it. As for what he narrated from Ali, it is not [accepted] to me. 50 - I asked him: Did Qatadah hear from Khilas? He said: Yes.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 51 - I asked him about Abu Abd Allah Al-Jadali. He spoke a soft [critical] word. 52 - I said: Who are the companions of Al-Thawri? He said: Yahya, Waki', Abd al-Rahman, and Abu Nu'aim. I said: You prioritized Waki' over Abd al-Rahman? He said: Waki' is a Sheikh. 53 - I said: Yahya bin Yaman and Mu'ammal, if they differ? He said: Leave this. It was as if he softened their status. Then he said: Mu'ammal used to make mistakes.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 54 - I asked him about Mujalid bin Sa'id, how is he? He said: So-and-so [mediocre]. And he said: Yahya narrated from him. I said: Is he used as proof? He spoke with soft [critical] words. 55 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Ishaq, how is he? He said: He is Hasan (good) in Hadith, but when he combines from two men... I said: How? He said: He narrates from Al-Zuhri and another man, so he carries the hadith of this one onto that one. Then he said: Ya'qub said: I heard my father say: I heard the Maghazi [Campaigns] from him three times; he would dismantle it and change it. 56 - He said: Malik said—and he mentioned him—so he said: A Dajjal [imposter/liar] from the Dajjals.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 57 - Abu Abd Allah said: Muhammad bin Ishaq came to Baghdad, and he did not care from whom he reported, from Al-Kalbi and others. 58 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Amr. He said: Yahya narrated from him, and perhaps he raised [attributed to the Prophet]...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...hadiths that others stopped [at the Companion], and this is from his side. He said: He came to Al-A'mash, but he did not honor him. 59 - I asked him about Thabit and Humaid: which of them is more established regarding Anas? He said: Thabit. He said: Humaid used to go with Thabit to [listen to] Hadith. And Anas indeed said: Thabit is a little creature (Duwaibah) I love. 60 - I asked him about Ibn Abi Dhi'b, how is he? He said: Trustworthy. I said: Regarding Al-Zuhri? He said: So-and-so [mediocre]. He narrated hadiths as if he wanted...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...to be contradicted. 61 - I said to Abu Abd Allah: So Abd al-Rahman bin Ishaq, how is he? He said: As for what we wrote from his Hadith, he narrated from Al-Zuhri hadiths as if he wanted to be unique in them. Then he mentioned the hadith of Muhammad bin Jubair regarding the alliance, the Alliance of the Perfumed Ones. Abu Abd Allah denied it and said: No one other than him narrated it.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 63 - I spoke to Abu Abd Allah regarding Sa'd bin Ibrahim, that Malik did not narrate from him. Abu Abd Allah disliked what I said and said: Sufyan used to say: "Sa'd is Sa'd." He said: Al-Zuhri said: "Who has a father like Sa'd?" And he mentioned...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...his virtue. He said: He used to enjoin the good. He was in need, so he entered into the judiciary. When he was removed, the likes of him were still held in awe while he was a judge. I said: But Malik narrated from Idris, from Shu'bah, from Sa'd? He said: Yes, and he marveled. He said: Malik used to critique the men (narrators). 63 - I asked him about Al-Suddi. He said: There is no harm in him. He is Trustworthy to me, except that Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: Shu'bah said to me regarding a hadith he narrated from Al-Suddi: "He raised it [attributed it to Prophet], and I do not raise it." Ibn Mahdi said: I said: "Isra'il narrated it as Marfu'." Shu'bah gestured with his head, meaning "Yes."

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 64 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Matar Al-Warraq. He spoke a soft [critical] word about him and said: He is like Ibn Abi Laila. 65 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Musa Al-Juhani. He said: There is no harm in him, and he spoke well of him. 66 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Ali bin Al-Mubarak. He said: There is no harm in him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: Then he said: He was accused of Tashayyu' (Shi'ism). 67 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Abu Al-Zubair. He said: People have narrated from him and tolerated him. Ayyub narrated from him, and more than one person, except that Shu'bah did not narrate from him. I said: Is he soft [weak] in Hadith? He seemed to soften him. I said: Is Abu Al-Zubair more beloved to you or Abu Nadrah? He said: Abu Nadrah is more beloved to me. 68 - I asked him about Ja'far bin Muhammad. He said: Yahya narrated from him, and he softened him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 69 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Salih, the Mawla of Al-Taw'amah. He said: Malik said: "I saw him confused/mixed up," and he did not carry [narrate] from him. Then he said: Whoever heard from him before the confusion, then it is as if it is [acceptable]. 70 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Al-Nadr bin Arabi. He said: There is no harm in him. 71 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Al-Wazi' bin Nafi'. He said: I do not know how he is. He seemed to weaken him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 72 - I asked him about Ma'qil bin Ubaid Allah. He said: Trustworthy. 73 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Asim Al-Ahwal. He said: Trustworthy. I said: Yahya bin Ma'in spoke against him. He marveled and said: Trustworthy. 74 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Asim bin Abi Al-Nujud. He said: He is the teacher of Abu Bakr bin Ayyash; there is no harm in him. And it was as if he softened him. 75 - I asked about Jabir Al-Ju'fi. He said: I used not to write his Hadith, then I wrote [it] to consider it [for corroboration].

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 76 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Ibn Lahi'ah. He softened his status [weakened him] and said: Whoever heard from him early on [it is acceptable]. 77 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Abd Allah bin Abi Ya'qub. He said: Trustworthy (Thiqah). 78 - I asked him about Hisham bin Hassan. He said: Ayyub and Ibn Awn are more beloved to me. He spoke well of Hisham's status. He said: He narrated hadiths that he raised [to the Prophet], while they [others] stopped them [at the Companion]; their methodology was to shorten the Hadith and stop it.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 79 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Mubarak bin Fadalah and Abu Hilal. He said: They are close to each other; neither of them is all that [strong]. I used not to extract anything from Mubarak, then later [I did]. 80 - I asked him about Abu Al-Ashhab. He said: He is not disputed; he is Trustworthy (Thiqah). 81 - I asked him about Jarir bin Hazim. He said: In some of his Hadith there is something, but there is no harm in him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 82 - I asked him about Yazid Al-Nahwi. He said: So-and-so [mediocre]. 83 - I asked him about Farqad Al-Sabakhi. He said: A righteous man, but his Hadith is not all that. 84 - I asked him about Al-Mughirah bin Ziyad Al-Mawsili. He softened his status.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 85 - I asked him about Ibrahim bin Muhajir. He softened his status. 86 - I heard him say: Yahya bin Ma'in spoke—and Yahya was in the presence of Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi—so Yahya said: 'Ibrahim bin Muhajir'—and he mentioned another man—'are two weak, despicable/insignificant men.' Abd al-Rahman attacked him strongly [for saying that]. Abu Abd Allah started marveling at this speech, saying: 'Despicable men?' 87 - I said to him: I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about the fasting person performing cupping. He said: 'There is nothing against him; no report is established regarding it.' Abu Abd Allah said: This is speech of recklessness.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 88 - He said: Yazid Al-Raqashi is not someone to be used as proof. 89 - He said: Ash'ath bin Talq, who narrated from Ibn Umar, he spoke about him with soft [critical] speech.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 90 - He said regarding Musa bin Dihqan: He softened his status. 91 - He said regarding Abu Dad Nufai': He softened his status. 92 - He said regarding Al-Khazraj bin Uthman Al-Sa'di. He said: This is a Trustworthy one (Thiqah). 93 - He said regarding Abu Ubaidah Al-Naji: He weakened his status.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 94 - He said regarding Khasib bin Jahdar: Abandoned (Matruk) in Hadith. 95 - He said regarding Abu Bakr Al-Hudhali: He weakened his status. 96 - He mentioned Al-Rabi' bin Sabih and spoke about him with soft [critical] speech. 97 - He said regarding Al-Suddi and Ibn Muhajir: Two Trustworthy ones (Thiqatan). Then he said: Mansur...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...and Ayyub are more established than them. 98 - I asked him about Qatan, whom Mughirah narrated from. He said: I do not know him, except by what Mughirah narrated from him. I said: Jarir mentioned him with a bad mention. He said: I do not know; Jarir knows him and his land better. 99 - He mentioned Amir bin Shaqiq, who narrated from Abu Wa'il, and he spoke something about him. 100 - He said regarding Rakin Al-Dabbi: Abu Nu'aim narrated to us from him, and he did not approve of him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: He said: Al-Thawri narrated three hadiths from him. 101 - I said: Al-Haitham whom Mughirah narrated from? He said: I do not know him, except by what Mughirah narrated from him. 102 - He mentioned Umar bin Ya'la and did not approve of him. He said: Ismail bin Sami', there is no harm in him. 103 - He said: Salm bin Abd al-Rahman, he is not the brother of Husain, and there is no harm in him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 104 - He mentioned Umarah bin Al-Qa'qa' and said: Trustworthy (Thiqah). 105 - He said: Habib bin Abi Amrah is Trustworthy. 106 - He mentioned Abd Allah bin Sa'id bin Jubair and said: Ayyub narrated from him, and there is no harm in him. 107 - He mentioned Suhail bin Abi Salih and said: There is no harm in him. 108 - He mentioned Yunus bin Khabbab, spoke about him, and did not approve of him. He said: This one...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...used to attack Uthman. 109 - Abu Awana told us, he said: I heard Ali bin Abd al-Aziz say: Ibrahim bin Ziyad Sablan told us, he said: I heard Abbad bin Abbad...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...say: I came one day to Yunus bin Khabbab at Mina, and I asked him about the Hadith of the Grave. He narrated it to me and said: 'There is something in it that the Murji'ah concealed,' until he was asked about Ali. 110 - I asked him about Hammam bin Munabbih. He said: Trustworthy (Thiqah). 111 - He said: Yahya bin Sa'id bin Sa'id and Sa'd bin Sa'id; he weakened Sa'd. 112 - I asked him about Al-Nu'man bin Rashid. He said: He is Jazari [from Jazira], he is not all that.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 113 - He was asked about Abd Allah bin Sa'id bin Abi Sa'id. He said: He is not all that; Sufyan has narrated from him. 114 - I asked him about Ubaid Allah bin Abi Ja'far, a Sheikh who narrated from Ata' from Ibn Abbas who said: 'The gifts of princes are Ghulul (betrayal/stealing).' He said: I do not know him. I said: Then Ubaid Allah bin Abi Ja'far [the jurist]? He said: It used to be said that he is good in Fiqh, from the people of Medina. I said: How is he in Hadith? He said: Ha [hesitated].

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 115 - He mentioned Ibn Sam'an and said: He was Abandoned (Matruk) in Hadith. He was asked about Ibn Sam'an, so he said: I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'd swear that he is a liar. He said: And he used to say: 'I heard Mujahid.' So Ibn Ishaq would say: 'By Allah, I am older than him, and I did not hear from him.' 116 - He was asked about Muhammad bin Amr and Al-Ala'. He said: Al-Ala' is more beloved to me...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...and that is because Muhammad bin Amr perhaps said 'Al-Ashbah' [forms/apparitions - mistaken wording]. 117 - He was asked about Kharijah bin Mus'ab, so he weakened him and said: Ibn Al-Mubarak did not narrate anything from him in his books. Ibn Abi Rizmah said to him: 'Yes he did, one hadith.' He said: 'They spoke to Ibn Al-Mubarak about him, so he said: How can I narrate from a man who narrated troublesome Munkar hadith?' 118 - I asked him about Zaid bin Abi Unaisah: How is he? He moved his hand and said: Salih (Good), but he is not all that.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 120 - Abu Abd Allah said to me: Asim bin Ubaid Allah, the Sheikhs used to be in awe of [wary of] his Hadith.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 121 - I asked him about Abu Hamzah Al-Attar. He said: I do not know how he is. 122 - I asked him about Hakim bin Jubair. He said: He is not all that. 123 - I asked Abu Abd Allah about Amr bin Abd Allah who narrated from Ikrimah. He said: This one is called Amr Barq. Ikrimah stayed with his father, and he heard a book from him. The people of Yemen did not approve of him. Abu Abd Allah gestured with his hand—meaning he used to drink—and smiled. Ma'mar used to narrate from him saying: 'From a man,' without naming him, except to Ibn Al-Mubarak, for he named him; he said: Barq.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 124 - He mentioned Abd Allah Al-Umari and did not approve of him. He said: Soft [weak] in Hadith. 125 - He said regarding Ali bin Ali Al-Rifa'i: There was no harm in this Sheikh, except that he raised [attributed to the Prophet] hadiths. 126 - He mentioned Muhammad bin Abi Hafsah and did not approve of him, and I think he mentioned that he held a bad opinion [sect].

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 127 - He mentioned Ja'far bin Maimun and did not approve of him. 128 - He mentioned Hammad bin Abi Sulaiman and said: Trustworthy (Thiqah). 129 - He mentioned Abu Al-Rabi' Al-Samman and said: His Hadith is nothing. 130 - He said: Salih bin Abi Al-Akhdar, he did not approve of him, and he said: Yahya would not narrate from him. Abu Abd Allah said: He narrated hadiths to them, then he said:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: I did not hear them. 131 - He said: Abd al-Malik bin Umair, in his Hadith there is disturbance (Idtirab).

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
132 - And he said: Qais bin Sa'd is trustworthy (Thiqah).
133 - And he said: Abu Ma'shar - and he did not approve of him, and spoke about him with something [critical].
134 - And I asked him about Salim bin Abi Hafsah, and he said: There is no harm in him, except that he was a Shi'i.
135 - And Abu Abdullah said: Abu Maryam is abandoned in Hadith (Matruk al-Hadith), and he used to

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: be accused of Shi'ism. And Shu'bah wrote from him. The elders (Shuyukh) used to know him of old. Shu'bah said: Abu Maryam said to a man: Did Yahya bin Waththab narrate to you that Masruq narrated to them that Abdullah narrated to them? He said: Abu Maryam, if anyone were to say to him: 'Who narrated to you?' or 'How did you hear?', he would slap his eye.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
136 - I asked him about Al-Mughirah bin Al-Nu'man, so he said: He is so-and-so [indicating mediocrity or weakness].
137 - I asked Abu Abdullah about Layth bin Abi Sulaim, so he said: He is not that [strong].
138 - I asked him about Al-Dahhak bin Yasar, did he hear from Abu Uthman? He said: I do not know. And he spoke about him with soft words [indicating weakness].
139 - I asked him about Abu Bakr bin Abi Sabrah. He said: Ibn Jurayj narrated from him. Hajjaj said: He said: I have seventy thousand [hadiths] regarding the Halal and Haram.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
140 - Abu Abdullah said: We were with Ismail, and the hadith of Muhammad bin Ishaq from Amr bin Shu'aib from his father from his grandfather was mentioned to him: I said: "O Messenger of Allah, should I write from you what I hear? He said: Yes. I said: In anger and pleasure?" So I heard Ismail saying: "I seek refuge in Allah from lying." So I said: How was the status of Amr bin Shu'aib with Ismail, did he not approve of him? He said: He narrated from him, but the way (Madhhab) of Muhammad bin Sirin, Ayyub, and Ibn Awn was not to write [from him].
141 - I said: Did Yahya hear anything from Umar bin Amir? He said: I do not know that he narrated anything from him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
142 - I asked him who is greater, Mansur bin Al-Mu'tamir or Ibn Zadhan? He said: I do not know.
143 - And he mentioned Jarir bin Hazim, so he said: He was a Hafiz. And he said once: There is something in some of his hadith.
144 - And Abu Abdullah said: I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'd swear by Allah that Ibn Sam'an is a liar.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
145 - And he said regarding Ishaq bin Yahya bin Talhah: His hadith is nothing.
146 - And he mentioned Husain bin Waqid, so he said: He is not that [strong].
147 - And he was asked about Ali bin Ghurab, so he said: His hadith was the hadith of the people of truth.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
148 - I said to him: Is Sa'id bin Abdul-Jabbar a Meccan? He said: No, this one is from the people of Sham. Abu Badr narrated two hadiths from him to us, and I have crossed them out. I said: And what is his condition? He said: He narrated denounced (Manakir) hadiths.
149 - I asked him about Asal bin Sufyan, so he softened his status.
150 - I asked him about Bishr bin Harb, so he said: "We are fasting" [implying refraining from comment], and he weakened him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 151 - I asked him about Dawud bin Yazid Al-Awdi, and he said: This is Al-Za'afiri, and he is the uncle of Ibn Idris. They asked him about the hadith of Al-Sha'bi: 'The dowry shall not be less than ten.' He did not know it. So Sharik asked him and prompted him with it, so he narrated it. And he weakened him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
152 - And I asked him about Azhar bin Sinan, so he softened him and said: He narrated a hadith he mentioned regarding divorce.
153 - I asked him about Abdullah bin Maysarah, from whom Yazid bin Harun narrated. He softened him and said: We narrate from him.
154 - And I asked him about Dawud bin Farahij, so he said: This is a Medinan, and he softened his status.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
155 - I asked him about Abu Amir Al-Khazzaz, so he said: People have narrated from him, and he softened his status.
156 - I asked him about Abbad bin Suhayb, so he said: He used to be accused of [the heresy of] Qadar (free will), and his status was close to that of Abu Amir Al-Khazzaz.
157 - I asked him about Al-Zubayr bin Sa'id, so he softened his status.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
158 - I asked him about Isa bin Al-Musayyib, so he said: This is a Kufan, and he softened him.
159 - I asked him about Abu Dawud Nufai' and about Abu Al-Warqa. So he softened the status of Nufai' and weakened Abu Al-Warqa, and put Abu Dawud ahead of him, saying: He is better.
160 - I asked him about Harithah bin Abi Al-Rijal, so he said: He is not that [strong].

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
161 - And I asked him about his brother Abdul-Rahman, so he said: There is no harm in him.
162 - I asked him about Ibn Ajlan, so he said: Trustworthy. I said: Yahya has indeed weakened him. He said: He was trustworthy, but the hadith of Al-Maqburi became confused for him; it was from a man, but he made it from Abu Huraira.
163 - I asked him about Rishdin. He said: I am not expert on his affair, I do not know.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
164 - I asked him, saying: Shu'bah [narrated] from Attab, the client of Ibn Hurmuz. Who is Attab the son of? He said: I do not know.
165 - I said: Al-Hakam bin Atiyah, how is he? He said: The Basran? I said: Yes, the one who narrated from Thabit. He said: To me, there was no

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
harm in him, then it reached me that he narrated denounced (Manakir) hadiths. And it was as if he weakened him.
166 - I asked him about Imran Al-Qattan, so he said: He is not that [strong], and he weakened him.
167 - I asked him about Ismail bin Rafi', he said: I do not know. Ibn Abi Mulaykah from Abdul-Rahman bin Al-Sa'ib. He gestured disapprovingly with his hand and said: The hadith of this one is nothing.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 168 - And he said regarding the hadith of Abu Al-Nadr from Abu Ja'far Al-Razi from Yazid bin Abdullah: He said: This is Levantine (Shami). He mentioned the hadith of Wathilah, the story of the camel. He said: Abu Ja'far did not hear from this one; he only narrated this from Muhammad bin Sa'id. And Allah knows best. So he abandoned Muhammad bin Sa'id and said: From Zaid.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
I said: What is the condition of Muhammad bin Sa'id? He said: They say, and Allah knows best, that Abu Ja'far crucified him for heresy (Zandaqah), and he is abandoned in Hadith.
169 - I said: So Abu Jabir Al-Bayadi, how is he? He said: It reached me from Malik that he used to say he used to lie.
170 - I said: So how is Al-Hasan bin Umarah? He said: Abandoned in Hadith.
171 - I asked him about Abu Harun Al-Abdi. He said: He is not that [strong].

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
172 - And I asked him about Abbad bin Kathir, so he said: He is not that [strong]. I said: Was there any Qadar (heretical belief in free will) in him? He said: No, except that his hadith is not that [strong].
173 - I said to him: What do you say about Sa'id bin Jumhan? So he said: Trustworthy. Al-Awwam bin Hawshab narrated from him, and Hammad narrated from him. And I think he mentioned Abdul-Warith and others.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
I said: It is narrated from Yahya Al-Qattan that he was asked about him and did not approve of him. He said: False. And he got angry and said: No one said this except Ali bin Al-Madini; I never heard Yahya speak anything about him.
174 - And he mentioned Abdullah bin Uthman bin Khuthaym, saying: He narrated from Ata regarding divorce, forgetting that it is binding, and he narrated from Ibn Jurayj from

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
Ata the opposite of it. I said: So how is Ibn Khuthaym? He said: Ibn Jurayj is more established than him.
175 - Abu Awanah told us, Abu Bakr told us, Abu Abdullah Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Hanbal told us, he said: I heard Muhammad bin Ja'far Al-Warkani say: We were with Hushaim, and a man said to him: Salamah Al-Ahmar told us from Hammad from Ibrahim, who said: The Companions of the Prophet, peace be upon him, used to assume Ihram at the watering place. So Hushaim said: Spare us from the hadith of liars. Abu Abdullah smiled and said: There is nothing to this [hadith]. And he said: I saw Salamah.
176 - And I asked Abu Abdullah about Abu Al-Samh. I said: How is he? He said: He narrated hadiths from Abu Al-Haytham. And he smiled. I said: How is he? He said: I do not know what he is. I said: Then Abu Al-Haytham? He said: Trustworthy.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
177 - And he said: Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan is not that [strong], yet Yahya narrated from him.
178 - And I asked him about Sufyan bin Husain: How is he? He said: He is not that [strong], and he weakened him.
179 - And I asked him about Ishaq bin Rashid, so he said: Trustworthy.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
180 - And he said regarding Sawwar bin Mus'ab: He is nothing.
181 - I said to him: Is the hadith of Abu Al-Zubayr used as proof? So he said: Abu Al-Zubayr, people narrate from him, and he is used as proof.
182 - I asked him about Mubarak bin Fadalah. He said: What he narrated from Al-Hasan is used as proof. And he said: He entered upon Abu Ja'far, and began saying: 'O Commander of the Faithful, I heard Al-Hasan say and I heard Al-Hasan say.' Then Abu Abdullah said: Abu Ja'far used to admire the affair of Al-Hasan.
183 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Jabir, so he said: People narrate from him. And he said: Ibn Mahdi used to narrate from Muhammad bin Jabir, then he abandoned him later.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
184 - And he was asked about Al-A'mash, from Abu Ayyub, from Abdullah bin Amr, from the Prophet, peace be upon him: "The Hour will not be established until obscenity and the severing of kinship ties appear." He said: I do not know who this Abu Ayyub is? I do not know him. It was said to him: Is this Yahya bin Malik, whom Qatadah narrated from? He said: I do not know.
185 - I asked him about Usamah bin Zaid. He said: Al-Laythi is stronger than this one,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
he means Ibn Zaid bin Aslam.
186 - I said: How was Ismail bin Salim? He said: There is no harm in him. I said: He narrated from Abu Awanah from Ismail bin Salim that he heard Zubayd say: It was in the story of Mu'awiyah. He said: And who heard this from Abu Awanah? Then he said: He possessed hadiths of the Shi'a, and Shu'bah looked into his books for him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
187 - He was asked about Al-Hasan bin Salih, so he said: Trustworthy, except that his school of thought (Madhhab) was 'that' [implying Shi'ism/Zaydi].
188 - I said: Yazid bin Abdullah or Abdul-Malik Al-Nawfali? He said: I do not know. This one narrated the hadith of Abu Huraira. I said: Then his son? He said: He came here, and he weakened him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
189 - And he said regarding Talid bin Sulaiman: His school of thought was Shi'ism, and he saw no harm in him.
190 - And he said: Thawr bin Yazid is trustworthy, except that he held the view of Qadar (free will).
191 - And he said: Hamzah Al-Zayyat is trustworthy in Hadith, but I dislike his Recitation (Qira'ah).

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
192 - And he said: Zakariya bin Manzur is a Sheikh, and he softened him.
193 - I asked him about Musa bin Uqbah, Ibrahim bin Uqbah, and Muhammad bin

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
Uqbah. He said: Musa is trustworthy. And he said: There is no harm in them.
194 - I asked him about Al-Ash'ath, Al-Nu'man, and Sa'id bin Abi Khalid. He said: Sa'id, I do not know him. And he said: Ismail narrated from Al-Nu'man and Al-Ash'ath. I said: How are they? So he said: There is no harm in them; he only narrated a hadith or two from them.
195 - I asked him about Umar bin Nafi' and Abdullah bin Nafi'. He said: Umar, I do not know him. And Abu Bakr bin Nafi', something was said about him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
196 - I asked him about the nephew of Ibn Shihab: How is he? He said: So-so.
197 - And Abu Abdullah was asked about Abdul-Malik bin Umair, so he said: Agitated (Mudtarib) in Hadith. Rarely did anyone narrate from him except that they differed upon him. It was said: Is he more beloved to you or Asim? He said: Asim.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
198 - He was asked about Al-Hasan bin Dinar, and he weakened him.
199 - And he was asked about Abu Shaybah, so he weakened him.
200 - I asked him about Abdullah bin Muslim, who narrated from Ibn Buraydah. I said: Who is Abdullah bin Muslim? He said: I do not know him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
201 - And I asked him about Salih bin Hayyan. He said: He is not that [strong], and he rejected his hadith.
202 - I asked him: Did Ma'mar hear from Yahya bin Sa'id? He said: No.
203 - And he said: Sadaqah Al-Dimashqi is nothing; he is weak in Hadith.
204 - It was said to him: Does he narrate from Al-Ifriqi? He said: No, he is Denounced (Munkar) in Hadith. And he entered upon Abu Ja'far and spoke good words, so he [Abu Ja'far] said

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
to him: 'You have preached well.'
205 - And I heard him say: Malik bin Anas, to me, is an Imam from the Imams of the Muslims.
206 - I asked him about Qais bin Al-Rabi', so he softened him. I said: Did not Shu'bah narrate from him? He said: Yes.
207 - And he was asked about Hudayj, so he said: I do not know how he is.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
208 - I asked him about Sa'id bin Muhammad Al-Warraq, so he softened him and spoke something [critical].
209 - And he said: Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan is not that [strong], yet Yahya narrated from him.
210 - I asked him about Al-Darawardi, so he said: I do not know what to say to you about him; it is as if some of his hadiths are denounced.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
211 - I asked him about Ibn Abi Hazim, so he said: There is no harm in him. I said: Is he more pleasing to you than Al-Darawardi? He said: Yes.
212 - And he said: Ibn Jabr, who narrated from Ibn Umar, I do not know him

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
nor do I know who he is.
213 - I asked him about Abdul-Majid bin Abdul-Aziz bin Abi Rawad, how is he? He said: He was a Murji'. I wrote from him. And they used to say: He corrupted his father. And he was hostile to Ibn Uyainah. Abu Abdullah used to narrate from the Murji' if he was not a caller [to his innovation] or argumentative.
214 - I said: Yahya Al-Qattan, what did he used to say about Sharik? He said: He did not approve of him, and he only mentioned a little from him by way of discussion, a hadith or two.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
215 - I said: So Abu Bakr bin Ayyash, how was he in his [Yahya's] view? He said: He did not approve of him. And Yahya did not approve of Ibrahim bin Sa'd. I said: And what was his condition with him? He said: He was in charge of the Treasury (Bayt al-Mal).
216 - I asked him about Ibrahim bin Al-Hakam bin Aban, so he said: He is not that [strong]. I wrote from him and stayed with him for days.
217 - I asked him about Yazid bin Abi Hakim, so he said: I wrote from him less than what I wrote from Ibrahim. I relied on Ibrahim, then Ibrahim narrated afterwards

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
denounced (Munkarah) hadiths, so his status weakened, and he put Yazid bin Abi Hakim ahead of him.
218 - And he was asked about Al-Nadr bin Ismail Abu Al-Mughirah, so he said: We wrote from him; he is not strong. His hadith is considered, but [mostly] what was regarding heart-softeners (Raqa'iq). And he had more hadith than Ibn Al-Sammak.
219 - And he said: The school of thought of Al-Hasan bin Salih does not please us; he used to refrain from [attending] Friday prayer.
220 - I said to him: Is Abu Badr trustworthy? He said: I hope that he is truthful.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
He sat with righteous people.
221 - I said to him: What do you think regarding the hadith of Ubaidullah bin Musa? He said: He used to narrate bad hadiths, and I used not to extract anything from him, then I extracted [later].
222 - And he was asked about Ayyub bin Jabir, so he said: Some of our companions told me from Isa bin Yunus that he used to accuse him of lying. It was said to him: So what was his condition, what did they denounce about him? He said: They saw additions/insertions in his book.
223 - It was said to him: Did you write from Ahmad bin Ishaq Al-Hadrami? He said: No, I left him deliberately. It was said to him: What did you disapprove of in him? He said: He was to me,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
if Allah wills, truthful, but I left him because of Ibn Aktham, and he got involved in something for him.
224 - He was asked about Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Umawi, so he said: He did not have much activity in Hadith.
225 - It was said to him: So Abdul-Samad bin Al-Warith? He said: There was no harm in him,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
and I hope he was opposing his father in that opinion [Mu'tazila/Qadari opinion].
226 - I asked him about Ya'qub bin Ishaq Al-Hadrami, so he put his brother Ahmad ahead of him. He said: There was no harm in Ahmad, but I left him because of Ibn Aktham. And he said: I was with Ibn Mahdi, and Ya'qub bin Ishaq came, and he [Ibn Mahdi] was harsh with him, so I did not write anything from him.
227 - I asked him about Asim bin Ali. I said: Yahya said: Every 'Asim' in the world is weak. He said: I know nothing but good from him. His hadith was correct. The hadith of Shu'bah and Al-Mas'udi, how correct they were!

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
228 - And he said: When Qais bin Al-Rabi' was mentioned to Waki', he would say: Allah's help is sought.
229 - And he said: Abu Hudhayfah, the one in Basra, was among the people who made the most mistakes.
230 - And he mentioned Muhammad bin Al-Qasim Al-Asadi, so he said: He does not deserve for anything to be narrated from him; he narrated denounced hadiths.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 231 - And he said regarding Ruhayl bin Muawiyah, the brother of Zuhair. He said: He is an old man, Zuhair narrated from him. And I have no knowledge of the hadith of Hudayj. It was said to him: He narrated from Abu Ishaq, from Al-Bara', that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to give salam to his right and to his left. He said: This is Munkar (denounced). 232 - And Abu Abdullah said: Ali bin Mushir was appointed as judge of Mosul,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
but he was not praised in his judgeship. I said: But people desire his hadith? He said: Because his hadith is the hadith of the people of truth.
233 - And he said: Shu'aib bin Abi Hamzah used to hardly narrate. When death approached him, he said: Gather So-and-so and So-and-so for me. So Baqiyyah gathered, and they say Abu Al-Yaman, and they mentioned Ali bin Ayyash - I do not know if he was [there] or not? So he said: These are my books, narrate them from me. So Abu Al-Yaman used to say: Shu'aib told me. And I do not know if he was with them or not?

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 234 - And he mentioned Al-Himmani, so I said: He narrated from you the hadith of Ishaq Al-Azraq, the hadith of Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah: 'Cool off with the prayer,' and he claimed that he

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
heard it at the door of Ibn Ulayyah. So he denied that he heard it, and said: There is nothing of this. I said: He claimed that this was during discussion. He said: And I knew in the days of Ismail that this was with me - meaning I only brought it out at the end. And he said: Tell Harun Al-Hammal to strike out the hadith of Al-Himmani.
235 - It was said to him: So Tammam bin Najih, what is his condition? He said: I do not know.
236 - It was said to him: So Ismail bin Mujalid? He said: I do not know, people have narrated from him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
237 - And Abu Abdullah said: I was with Yahya bin Ma'in, and he met Abu Badr. He said to him: Fear Allah, O Sheikh, and look at these hadiths, lest your son is giving them to you. Abu Abdullah said: So I felt shy and moved aside to a corner. It reached me that he said: If you are lying, may Allah do to you and do.
238 - I asked him about Uthman bin Matar, how is he? He said: So-and-so [weak].
239 - I asked him about Talhah bin Yazid or Ibn Zaid Al-Qurashi, so he said: He is not that [strong], he has narrated denounced (Manakir) hadiths.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
340 [sic, should be 240] - I said to him: Which is more beloved to you, Al-Hawdhi or Abu Al-Walid? He said: Al-Hawdhi was more astute than Abu Al-Walid and more established; he was vigilant, even though Abu Al-Walid was good in hadith from Shu'bah.
341 [sic, should be 241] - And he said: Affan said: Hammad bin Zaid said to Shu'aib bin Harb,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
'O Abu Salih, we have been invited to a feast,' so he would come. Abu Abdullah said: There was joking in Hammad.
342 [sic, should be 242] - And I heard him say: I heard Mu'ammal say: The people of Hadith in Mecca rioted against Sufyan, and among them was Shu'aib bin Harb, until they dismissed the Mustamli (dictator's assistant). And he said: Ibn Idris used not to go to a feast until he asked about it - meaning Nabidh (fermented drink).
243 - And he mentioned Abdul-Wahhab. I said: Did he write from Yahya bin Sulaym? He said: He said to us: I did not write from Yahya bin Sulaym except a hadith or

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
two hadiths.
244 - So I said to him: Indeed, he did not write from Ismail because of that speech? I said: And he said: People of innovation used to enter his house. He said: May Allah forgive him, indeed He looked into him with the Light of Allah. He did not deserve to be written from. People set him up on a platform, and Baghdad shook for him, and the people of Hadith humiliated him. And he said: I hope Allah has mercy on Ibn Zubaidah. When he brought Ismail in to him, he spoke to him with words, and he crawled from his place, so Ismail began saying to him: 'A slip of a scholar, a slip of a scholar.'

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
He said: And he used to narrate to Al-Marisi, except that the wicked one did not reveal that in those days.
245 - I said to him: Indeed Khalaf reported that Abu Usamah came to you in Kufa. He said: He lied, there was nothing of that. We were not granted the least of my writing from him, but my writing from Ibn Numair is a good amount.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
246 - And I heard him praising Duhaym, and saying: He is intelligent and firm.
247 - And he mentioned Hisham bin Ammar, so he said: Reckless, light. And he said: We were at the frontier (Thughur), and a young man was with us. He went to Yusuf bin Asbat and wrote hadiths from him. Among them was from Hisham, from Al-Hasan, regarding the Dhimmis if they break the covenant, he said: Their offspring are not taken captive. And he narrated from Mughirah, from Ibrahim, the like of it. He narrated both from Sufyan. I said: There is nothing from Mughirah from Ibrahim. I did not finish, and his memory had become confused.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
248 - And I heard him being asked about Al-Waqidi. It was said to him, Ibn Al-Mubarak said: Leave us from the sea of Al-Waqidi. He said: I witnessed Waki' being asked about a hadith regarding wiping pebbles, so he said: If I were with Al-Waqidi, he would have narrated to you like this.
249 - I asked him about Ismail bin Ayyash, so he deemed his narration from the Levantines good, and said: He is better regarding them than what he narrated from the Medinans and others.
250 - I spoke to him about Al-Walid, so he said: He makes many mistakes. I wrote them from a man from him. And he came to Mecca twice, and I wrote from him in one of them about four hundred hadiths, and a group had heard from him about eight hundred.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
251 - I said: Did you write anything from Ibn Wahb? He said: No.
252 - I said: So Yahya bin Sulaym? He said: A hadith or two hadiths; he used to make many mistakes.
253 - And he said: I did not think Al-Firyabi, despite his many mistakes, knew that taking [hadith] with Sufyan was strict.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
254 - And I asked him, saying: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, when he came to Kufa, did they hear from him while he was confused [in memory]? He said: No, their hearing is good; he was not confused.
255 - And Abu Abdullah was asked about: The hadith of Ibn Al-Mubarak, from Malik bin Anas, from Ibn Al-Munkadir, from Anas, from the Prophet, peace be upon him: "Whoever listens to a songstress, molten lead will be poured into his ear on the Day of Resurrection." It was said to him: A man in Aleppo narrated it and praised him well. He said: This is false.
256 - And he looked into the hadith of Asal bin Sufyan, from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, from Aisha, the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "He is not of us who does not chant the Quran,"

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
so he said: There is nothing of this. Whoever said: 'From Aisha,' has erred. He weakened Asal bin Sufyan.
257 - And I asked him about the hadith of Ismail bin Rafi'. He said: Ibn Abi Mulaykah told me, from Abdul-Rahman bin Al-Sa'ib. He shook his hand and said: There is nothing of this. And he weakened him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
258 - I said: What is the condition of Muhammad bin Sa'id? He said: They say, and Allah knows best, that Abu Ja'far crucified him for heresy (Zandaqah).
259 - And he said regarding the hadith of Yahya bin Sulaym, from Ubaidullah, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, who said: I traveled with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and Abu Bakr, and Umar, and Uthman, and they used to pray Dhuhr and Asr as two rak'ahs, two rak'ahs, not praying before it nor after it. He denounced it severely, and said: This is from Yahya bin Sulaym.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 260 - And he said regarding the hadith of Warqa', from Abu Al-Zinad, from Al-A'raj, from Abu Huraira: 'My wood (A'wadi) is Waqf.' He said: Warqa' erred in it, and Ibn Abi Al-Zinad was correct, he said: 'My slaves (A'budi) are Waqf.' Then he said: Ibn Abi Al-Zinad is more beloved to me than Warqa'.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
261 - I said: So how is Hasan bin Umarah? He said: Abandoned in Hadith.
262 - And he said regarding the hadith of Ubaidullah, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar in the likes of the story of Dhul-Yadayn. He said: He used to say - meaning Usamah - from Hisham, from Ibn Sirin, from Abu Huraira. Then he says: From Ubaidullah, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, the like of it.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
And he said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: It is only Mursal in the book of Ubaidullah. And it should only be as Yahya said. And he denounced it.
263 - And he said: We were with Ismail bin Ibrahim, and the hadith of Amr bin Shu'aib, from his father, from his grandfather was mentioned to him: I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, should I write from you what I hear? He said: Yes. He said: In anger and pleasure?' Abu Abdullah said: So I heard Ismail while he was saying: 'I seek refuge in Allah from lying and its people.' I said: It is as if he did not approve of Amr bin Shu'aib. He said: He used to narrate his hadith, but the way (Madhhab) of Ibn Sirin, Ayyub, and Ibn Awn was not to write [from him].
264 - And I mentioned to him the hadith of Al-Husain Al-Ju'fi, from Ibn Uyainah, from Amr bin Dinar, from Jabir: 'Aslam, may Allah grant it peace.' So he denounced it severely,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
and said: This is Abdullah bin Dinar, from Ibn Umar. Look where the illusion came from?
265 - And I mentioned the hadith of Abbad, from Ibn Abi Arubah, from Qatadah, from Anas, 'That Safiyyah menstruated after she had performed Tawaf,'

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
so he said: Abbad erred in it; it is only from Qatadah, from Ikrimah.
266 - And I asked him about the hadith of Ma'mar, from Thabit, from Anas, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, forbade Shighar (a type of marriage exchange). He said: This is a denounced (Munkar) hadith from the hadith of Thabit.
267 - And I asked him about the hadith of Asim bin Ubaidullah, which Ibn Jurayj narrates from him. He said: Asim bin Ubaidullah, the Sheikhs used to avoid his hadith.
268 - I said to him: Do you know from Al-Walid, from Al-Awza'i, from Yahya,

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: From Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (peace be upon him): "When were you written [ordained] as a Prophet?" He said: This is Munkar [denounced]. This is from the error of Al-Awza'i. He often makes mistakes regarding Yahya bin Abi Kathir. He used to say: "From Abu Al-Muhajir," but it is only...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Abu Al-Muhallab. 269 - I said: Do you know [the hadith] from Ata' bin Muslim Al-Khaffaf, from Muhammad bin Amr, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (peace be upon him): "The arrogant ones will be gathered in the form of small ants, people will trample them"?

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: He denied it and said: I do not know it. Ata' bin Muslim is Mudtarib [confused/shaky] in Hadith. 270 - I asked him about the hadith of Abd al-Razzaq, from Ma'mar, from Abu Ishaq, from Asim bin Damrah, from Ali, from the Prophet (peace be upon him): "That he wiped over splints [bandages]." He said: It is Batil [false]; there is nothing [authentic] in this. Who narrated this? I said:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: They mentioned it from the companion of Al-Zuhri. He spoke about him with harsh words. 271 - I presented to him a hadith they narrated from Muhammad bin Al-Jarrah, from Shu'bah, from Sufyan Al-Thawri, from Ali, in Marfu' form [attributed to the Prophet]: "Whoever prays such-and-such gets such-and-such, and whoever recites such-and-such gets such-and-such." He said: This is Batil [false], Mawdu' [fabricated]. I saw Ibn Al-Jarrah, and I saw he possessed hadiths that were fabricated for him; he did not know what Hadith was.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 272 - I cast upon [presented to] Abu Abd Allah a hadith narrated by Al-Fadl bin Musa, from Ibrahim bin Abd al-Rahman, from Ibn Jurayj, from Ata', from Ibn Abbas, who said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) opposed the funeral procession of Abu Talib." He said: This is Munkar [denounced]; this man is Majhul [unknown]. 273 - I said to Abu Abd Allah: Ali bin Al-Madini narrated from Al-Walid bin Muslim the hadith of Umar: "Leave him to his Creator." He said: This is a lie. Then he said: We wrote this from Al-Walid; it is actually...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ..."so leave him to the One who knows him better." This is a lie. 274 - I mentioned to him the hadith of Nafi', from Ibn Umar, from Umar: "Whoever sells a slave who has wealth, his wealth belongs to the seller." He said: Salim contradicted him. Al-Zuhri narrated it like this from Salim, from Ibn Umar, from the Prophet (peace be upon him). I said: Which one is the established one (Al-Thabt)? He smiled and said: Allah knows best. I said: Which of the two does your heart incline towards? He said: I think—and Allah knows best—towards Nafi'. 275 - He denied the hadith of Talhah bin Zaid, from Musa bin Yasar, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: "In honey, there is the tithe (Ushr)." He said: Talhah bin Zaid used to stay with Shu'bah; he is nothing [unreliable]. He used to fabricate Hadith. And Bishr bin Numair, these two are nothing. 276 - I showed him a hadith from Kathir bin Hisham, from Isa bin Ibrahim,

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: from Sa'id bin Sinan, from Abu Al-Zahiriyah, from Kathir bin Murrah, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Two sellers never met but that blessing overshadowed them." He said: There is nothing [valid] in this. Isa bin Ibrahim and Sa'id bin Sinan are nothing. 277 - He said regarding the hadith of Ya'la, from Ghalib bin Ubaid Allah Al-Uqayli:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: He is nothing. 278 - I mentioned to him the hadith of Zuhair bin Muhammad, from Al-Ala', from his father, from Abu Hurairah, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "When it is halfway through Sha'ban, then do not fast,"

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: He denied it and said: I asked Ibn Mahdi about it, but he did not narrate it to me, and he used to avoid it. Then Abu Abd Allah said: This is contrary to the hadiths narrated from the Prophet (peace be upon him). 279 - Abu Abd Allah was asked about Sa'id Al-Warraq. He said: He was not all that. They reported a Munkar hadith from him. I said: What is it? He said: From Yahya bin Sa'id, from Urwah, from Aisha, something about generosity.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 280 - Luwain was mentioned, and he said: He narrated a Munkar hadith from Ibn Uyainah that has no basis. I said: What is it? He said: From Amr bin Dinar, from Abu Ja'far, from Ibrahim bin Sa'd, from his father, the story of Ali: "I am not the one who expelled you, but Allah expelled you." He denied it strongly and said:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: It has no basis. 281 - I heard him say: Ibn Wahb's hadith was partly hearing (Sama'), partly presentation (Ard), and partly handing over (Munawalah). He used to take the book of what he did not hear and say: "Haywah said, So-and-so said." 282 - I heard him say: Salim bin Nuh, there is no harm in him; he is from the people of Basra. I wrote one hadith from him. 283 - I heard him say: There is no one in Kufa like Hannad; he is their Sheikh.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 284 - I heard Abu Abd Allah say: Abu Badr did not use to say "Haddathana" [narrated to us]. They wanted him to say "Haddathana Khasif," but he refused and said: "Is this not what I am saying: Khasif." 285 - I heard him say—and Ibn Abi Rizmah said to him: Do you have any need? He said: Yes, convey my greetings to Ibn Abi Umar, meaning Al-Adani. 286 - He was asked about Luwain. He said: I do not know him. 287 - The [book] "Al-Fawa'id" was mentioned to him. He said: Hadith from weak narrators might be needed at times, but the Munkar is always Munkar.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 288 - I asked him about Khalaf Al-Makhrumi. He said: They criticized him for following these hadiths. I said: Is he truthful (Saduq)? He said: I do not know him to lie, although he got involved with Al-Ansari in something; a hateful matter was reported about him. If he ordered a person [to get] something, he would buy it [himself first to sell it back]. I said: Was he practicing 'Inah (a usurious transaction)? He said: 'Inah is better than this. Then he said: I knew him to be chaste in stomach and private parts. 289 - I asked him about Mahmud bin Ghailan. He said: Trustworthy (Thiqah), I know him by Hadith, a man of Sunnah, he was imprisoned because of the Quran [issue].

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 290 - I said: Abu Bakr, the mustamli (dictation assistant) of Waki', do you know him? He said: Yes, he used to be with us writing Hadith. He wrote a book for me in his handwriting, I think he said "The Divorce". I said: He narrated a hadith they denied; how few are those who have it from Abd al-Razzaq. Do you have it, and did Khalaf have it? He said: He was with us that year. I said: Which one is more pleasing to you, him or Mahmud? He said: No, Mahmud. Other than this, Mahmud is more pleasing to me. 291 - Nuh bin Habib Al-Qumasi was mentioned. He said: He did not correspond with me. Goodness is evident upon him. I said: Should I write from him? He said: Yes. 292 - I asked him about Husain bin Al-Aswad. He said: I do not know him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 293 - I presented to Abu Abd Allah a book containing these names, the brothers: Imran bin Uyainah, Ibrahim bin Uyainah, and Muhammad bin Uyainah. He said: Muhammad was something strange; he was after Sufyan. He used to wear wool. Ibrahim bin Uyainah narrated hadiths that were denied, and speech regarding him was softened [criticized]. 294 - I asked him about Umar bin Ubaid, Muhammad bin Ubaid, and Ya'la...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...bin Ubaid. He declared them trustworthy, then said: Umar did not use to say "Haddathana" nor "Akhbarana". 295 - In it was Abu Bakr bin Nafi'. He said: Abu Bakr bin Nafi' is Abd Allah bin Nafi', and he spoke something [about him]. 296 - In it were Suhail, Abd Allah bin Abi Salih, and Abbad. He said: Suhail, there is no harm in him. Abd Allah is Abbad. 297 - In it were Abd Al-Hakim bin Abd Allah bin Abi Farwah, Abd Al-A'la bin...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Abd Allah bin Abi Farwah, and Ishaq bin Abd Allah bin Abi Farwah. He said: There is no harm in them, except Ishaq; for he shook his hand [dismissively], weakened him, and denied him. 298 - And Yunus bin Khabbab. He said: It has been reported about him, meaning regarding Uthman, and he softened him [criticized his status].

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 299 - In it was Ayyub bin Khalid bin Sadaqah Al-Ansari. He said: I do not know him. 300 - And Ayyub bin Bashir Al-Adawi. He said: I do not know him. 301 - In it were Ayyub bin Bashir Al-Ansari, Ayyub bin Kaysan, Ayyub bin Maysarah bin Halbas, Ayyub bin Marthad, and Ayyub bin...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Abd al-Rahman bin Sa'sa'ah, and Ayyub bin Musa Al-Qurashi. He said: Ayyub bin Musa is Thiqah (trustworthy). And Ayyub bin Thabit, Ayyub bin Abbad, and Ayyub bin Najih. It was as if he did not know these.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
302 - It was said to him: Muhammad bin Ishaq and the nephew of Al-Zuhri regarding the hadith of Al-Zuhri? He said: I do not know. And he moved his hand as if he was weakening them both.
303 - It was said to him: So Hafs and Abda? He said: As for Abda, he is truthful (Saduq) and firm (Thabt). As for Hafs, he shook his hand and said: Leave him in his hadith.
304 - It was said to him: So Za'idah and Zuhair? He said: These, Sufyan, Shu'bah, Za'idah, and Zuhair, these are the trustworthy ones (Thiqat).

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
305 - It was said to him: So Bishr bin Al-Sari? He said: Firm (Thabt).
306 - And he said: Shu'aib bin Harb told us, he said: I heard Sufyan saying: I would not like to agree with them on the truth - meaning Abu Hanifa.
307 - Abu Abdullah said: Ismail bin Umayyah and Ayyub bin Musa are from the people of Mecca, and they are cousins. Ayyub bin Musa was more beneficial to the people, except that Ismail was more trustworthy (Awthaq) than him and more firm (Athbat).
308 - And Abu Abdullah was asked about Abu Al-Salt, so he said: He narrated denounced (Manakir) hadiths.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: It was said to him: He narrated the hadith of Mujahid from Ali: 'I am the city of knowledge and Ali is its gate.' He said: We have not heard of this. It was said to him: Is this what you denounce of him? He said: Other than this. As for this, we have not heard of it. And he narrated a single hadith from Abdur-Razzaq which we do not know and have not heard. It was said to Abu Abdullah: Did he [narrate] from Abdur-Razzaq any of these bad hadiths? He said: I have not heard any of them.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
309 - And I asked him about Ubaidullah bin Musa: Did you extract anything from him? He said: Perhaps I extracted from him, and perhaps I crossed it out. He narrated from people who are not trustworthy. If it was from the hadith of Al-A'mash, then [it is accepted] upon that.
310 - And I asked him about Abu Bakr Al-Athram. I said: Were you forbidden from writing from him? He said: I did not say that Hadith should not be written from him; I only dislike these questions (Masa'il). Up to here is from Al-Marwadhi.
[Salih]
311 - Abu Awanah Ya'qub bin Ishaq told us, he said: Salih bin Ahmad bin Hanbal Abu Al-Fadl told us in Damascus, he said: My father told us, he said:

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
Affan told us, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, he said: I asked Shu'bah, Sufyan bin Sa'id, Sufyan bin Uyainah, and Malik bin Anas about a man who does not memorize or is accused regarding Hadith? They all said: Clarify his status.
312 - He said: My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Hamid bin Yunus said: If you wished for Isa Al-Hannat to narrate to me everything that the people of Medina do,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
he would narrate it to me.
313 - He said: My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Mu'alla bin Khalid told me, he said: Shu'bah said to me: If you wished for Abu Harun Al-Abdi to narrate to me from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri everything I see the people of Wasit fabricating, he would do so, or I would have done so.
314 - He said: My father told me, he said: Yahya bin Adam told us, he said: Ibn Idris told me, from Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah, he said: I saw Al-Sha'bi grab

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
the ear of Abu Salih, the companion of Al-Kalbi, and say: Do you interpret the Quran while you do not recite the Quran?
315 - He said: My father told me, he said: Yahya told us, he said: Mufaddal told us, from Mughirah, that he used to say: Indeed Abu Salih, the companion of Al-Kalbi, used to teach children. And he weakened his Tafsir. He said: I wrote the most correct of it. He said: We wonder at those who narrated from him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
316 - Abu Awanah told us, he said: Salih bin Ahmad told us, he said: My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Mu'adh told us, he said: Al-Ash'ath said: I never saw Hisham with Al-Hasan ever. He said: It was said to him: Indeed Amr says this, and if you say it, you strengthen him against him, or [he said] he told the truth or the like of this. He said: I will not say this, and I will not return to this.
317 - He said: My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Hammam told us, he said: Abu Dawud Al-A'ma came to us, and narrated to us from Zaid bin Arqam, from Al-Bara' bin Azib, and from the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). He said:

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
So we said to Qatadah: Indeed, Abu Dawud narrates to us and mentions these [Companions]. He said: This man is a liar; he used to beg from people before the Jarif plague.
318 - He said: My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Hammam told us, he said: Matar told me: Amr bin Ubaid met me and said: By Allah, indeed I and you are upon one matter. He said: And he lied, by Allah; he only meant regarding the earth [i.e., a worldly dispute]. He said: Matar said: By Allah, I do not believe him regarding anything.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
319 - He said: My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Hammad bin Salamah told us, he said: Humaid was among those who restrained themselves most from him. He said: So he came one day to Humaid, and Humaid narrated a Hadith to us. He said: So Amr said to him: Al-Hasan used to say it. He said: So Humaid said to me: Do not take anything from this one, for he lies about Al-Hasan. He used to come to Al-Hasan after he became old and say: O Abu Sa'id, do you not say such-and-such? Regarding something that was not his saying. He said: So the Sheikh would nod his head like this.
320 - He said: My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Hammad bin Salamah told us from Ali bin Zaid, he said: Al-Hasan did not hear from Abu Huraira.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
321 - He said: My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Wuhaib told us, he said: Ayyub said: Al-Hasan did not hear from Abu Huraira.
322 - He said: My father told me, he said: Abu Qatan told us, he said: Al-Mas'udi said: We did not catch anyone who spoke more according to the statements of the Shi'a than Adi bin Thabit.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
323 - He said: My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Wuhaib told us, he said: When Abdul-Majid died, Ayyub said to us: Stick to this young man - meaning Abdul-Wahhab Al-Thaqafi.
324 - He said: My father told me, he said: Affan told us, he said: Bishr bin Al-Mufaddal told us, he said: Ibn Awn told us, he said: When Muhammad died, we said: Who do we have? He said: So we said: Ayyub.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
325 - He said: My father told me, he said: Mu'adh told us, he said: Ibn Awn told us, he said: I mentioned to Ibrahim two men from the Saba'iyyah - meaning Al-Mughirah bin Sa'id and Abu Abdul-Rahim - and he knew them. He said: Beware of them, for they are liars.
326 - He said: My father told me, he said: Mu'adh told us, he said: Ismail bin Ibrahim told us, he said: Abdul-Aziz Al-Dabbagh came to me and said: Indeed, I

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
disapproved of [the look on] Ibn Awn's face, and I do not know what is the matter with him? He said: So I went with him to Ibn Awn and said: O Abu Awn, what is the matter with Abdul-Aziz? He said: Qutaibah, the owner of silk, informed me that he saw him walking with Amr bin Ubaid in the market. He said: So Abdul-Aziz said to him: I only asked him about something, and by Allah, I do not love his opinion. He [Ibn Awn] said: And he asked him too?
327 - He said: My father told me, he said: Al-Aswad bin Amir told us, he said: Abu Bakr - meaning Ibn Ayyash - informed us, from Asim, he said: Abu Abdul-Rahman used to say: No Haruri (Kharijite) shall sit with me, nor shall a man who sat with Shaqiq Al-Dabbi sit with me. Abu Bakr said: And he was argumentative. And he said:

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
And do not sit with the storytellers (Al-Qussas) except Abu Al-Ahwas, for he is not accused [of lying] among the companions of Abdullah. Up to here is from Salih bin Ahmad. [*]
328 - Abu Awanah told us, he said: Ya'qub bin Sufyan Al-Farisi told us in Fasa, he said: Ibrahim Abu Al-Mundhir Al-Hizami told us, he said: Ma'n bin Isa told me, he said: Malik used to say: Knowledge is not taken from four, and it is taken from whoever is other than them. It is not taken from a foolish person who openly declares his foolishness, even if he is the most narrating of people. And it is not taken from a liar who lies in the speech of

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
people, if that is tested against him, even if he is not accused of lying against the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. Nor from a person of whims (Bid'ah) who calls people to his whims. Nor from a Sheikh who has virtue and worship if he does not know what he is narrating. Ibrahim said: So I mentioned this hadith to Mutarrif bin Abdullah Al-Yasari, so he said: I do not know [about] this, but I testify that I indeed heard Malik bin Anas say: I have met in this city - meaning Medina - Sheikhs who possess virtue, righteousness, and worship, who narrate [hadith], yet I did not hear a single hadith from any one of them. It was said to him: Why, O Abu Abdullah? He said: They did not know what they were narrating.
329 - I heard Ya'qub say: I heard Al-Makki bin Ibrahim say: Malik bin Anas was beaten in the year one hundred and forty-seven; Sulaiman bin Ja'far bin Sulaiman bin Ali beat him seventy lashes.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
330 - I heard Ya'qub say: And I heard Al-Makki bin Ibrahim say: I sat with Muhammad bin Ishaq, and he used to dye [his hair/beard] black. He mentioned hadiths regarding the Attributes (Sifat), so I was repelled by them and did not return to him.
331 - I heard Ya'qub bin Sufyan say: I heard Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Dhakwan say: Yahya bin Ma'in said: Muhammad bin Al-Mubarak is the Sheikh of

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
the country after Abu Mushir. Abdullah said: And he used not to narrate from Amr bin Waqid until Marwan bin Muhammad Al-Tatiri died. He said: And Marwan used to say: Amr bin Waqid is a liar.
332 - Ya'qub told us, and I asked Abdul-Rahman Ibrahim about Amr bin Waqid. He said: Our Sheikhs did not narrate from him. And it was as if he did not doubt that he was a liar.
333 - I heard Ya'qub say: I heard Zaid - meaning Ibn Al-Mubarak -

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
say: I never met with Ibn Al-Madini except that he would say to me: What is the condition of Ghiyath? As if he was a liar.
334 - I heard Ya'qub say: I heard Abu Al-Aswad, and a man said to him: Indeed Ibn Bukair speaks against Abu Salih, so what do you say about him? He said: Abu Salih, if he says to you in Egypt 'Write from So-and-so,' then write [from him] and leave whatever is besides that.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
335 - I heard Ya'qub say: I heard Ibn Bukair say: We only narrate from Anbasah, a crazy fool. He said: And he used to come to me, and he was not a place for writing [hadith] that one should write from him.
[Al-Maymuni]
336 - Abu Awanah Ya'qub bin Ishaq told us, he said: Abdul-Malik bin Abdul-Hamid bin Abdul-Hamid bin Maimun bin Mihran Abu Al-Hasan Al-Maymuni told us, and I asked him, he said: Ahmad bin Hanbal told us, he said: Abdur-Razzaq told us, from Ma'mar, he said: I mentioned to Amr bin Dinar Abu Al-Sha'tha' and what the Ibadis claim [regarding him]. He said: I never heard anything from him regarding this ever. He said: So a man came and said: O Abu Muhammad, what did Abu Al-Sha'tha' say regarding such-and-such?

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
So he looked at me and smiled, and said: 'In azin shan ast' [This is their fabrication].
337 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Ahmad bin Hanbal told us, he said: Ibrahim - meaning Ibn Khalid Al-San'ani - told us, from Umayyah bin Shibl, from Ma'mar, from Ayyub, he said: Ikrimah came to us, and people gathered around him until he ascended to the roof of a house.
338 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Ahmad bin Hanbal told us, he said: Ibrahim told us, from Umayyah, from Amr bin Muslim, he said: Ikrimah came to

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
Tawus, so he gave him a noble camel worth sixty dinars. And he said: Should I not buy the knowledge of this slave for sixty dinars?
339 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Ahmad bin Hanbal told us, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: I heard Shu'bah from Khalid, he said: Ikrimah said to a man who was asking him: What is wrong with you? Have you become bankrupt (Ajbalta)? Meaning: Have you run out [of questions]? Shu'bah said: Then Ayyub told me, he said: Khalid was asking Ikrimah, then Khalid fell silent. So Ikrimah said: What is wrong with you? Have you become bankrupt (Ajbalta)? Meaning: Have you run out [of questions]? [Note: The text has 'Ajlabta' and 'Naqayta' which might be typos for 'Ajbalta' and 'Nafayta' or similar meanings of running out/stopping].

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
340 - Al-Maymuni told us, Amr bin Marzuq Al-Basri told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, from Amr bin Murrah, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, he said: A man asked him about something from the Book of Allah, but he did not say anything to him about it. Then he said to him: Ask about that the one who claims that nothing from the Book of Allah is hidden from him - meaning Ikrimah.
341 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: I heard Yahya say: Sufyan told me in Kufa during the life of Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim, from Umar regarding ostrich eggs. He said: This is not from his old hadith.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
342 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Ahmad bin Hanbal told us, he said: Hajjaj told us, he said: Shu'bah said: Rufay' caught up with Ali, but he did not hear from him - meaning Abu Al-Aliyah.
343 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Ahmad told us, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: Ibn Shubrumah said: There is no one in Mecca like him - meaning Hisham bin Hujayr.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
344 - He said: Ahmad told us, he said: Abdul-Samad told us, he said: Harb told us, he said: Yahya said: Everything from Abu Salam is only [from] a book.
345 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And Abu Abdullah narrated a hadith to us which he deemed good from Muhammad bin Ishaq. So I said to him: O Abu Abdullah, how beautiful are these stories that Ibn Ishaq brings! So he smiled at me in amazement.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
346 - And a man asked Abu Abdullah about a hadith, so he said: It is from Salih bin Abi Al-Akhdar. What can you do with it? He bid farewell to it with one of two words.
347 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Abu Abdullah told us, he said: Abdul-Hamid bin Abdul-Rahman Abu Yahya told us. Then he said to us: He was truthful in Hadith, if Allah wills. But we used to come to him in Kufa; he had no one with him but children. And perhaps he would come to Abu Muawiyah, and Abu Muawiyah would say to him words with which he joked. Then Abu Abdullah said: It is too foul for me to speak of. So I said to him: What about this son of his? He said: I do not know. Then he shook his hand in my face more than once, rejecting him.
348 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: They asked him - meaning Ahmad bin Hanbal - about

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
Ibn Tudrus, and he said: I do not know him.
349 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I asked him between me and him, seeking to understand and verify, I said: O Abu Abdullah, we have been tested with these Jahmiyyah; what do you say about the one who says Allah is not above the Throne? He said: Their speech all revolves around Kufr (disbelief). I said: What do you say about one who says Allah did not speak to Moses? He said: A disbeliever, no doubt about it. I said: Whoever says the Names of Allah are created (Muhdathah)? He said: A disbeliever. Then he said to me: 'Allah' is among His Names, so whoever says they are created has claimed that Allah is created. And he began to emphasize the gravity of their affair and declare them disbelievers. He recited: {Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers} [As-Saffat: 126]. And he mentioned another verse. I said: Whoever says Allah existed but His Knowledge did not? His face changed at all of this, and he was most changed and angry at this. Then he said to me: A disbeliever. And he said: Every day I increase in insight regarding these people.
350 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Abu Abdullah say: Shu'bah said: Qatadah did not meet Abu Rafi'; he only wrote from Khilas from him. And I heard him

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
say: They say that Qatadah did not hear from Mu'adhah.
351 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: My strongest assumption is that Abu Abdullah mentioned Abdullah bin Raja', so he declared him trustworthy and favored him. I said: What is his story? He said: He was [good], then he made mistakes and had delusions. He narrated a hadith one day, and it was said to him: You erred in it. So he said: Allah's help is sought regarding our errors in other things as well, or [he admitted] we have erred. Abu Abdullah said to me: So if the Sheikh admits this, know that he is safe. And perhaps something comes out of a person, and the heart testifies to his truthfulness.
352 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I asked him about the two sons of Buraidah. He said:

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
