Sulaiman is sweeter to the heart, and it is as if he is the more sound of the two in Hadith. And Abdullah has things that verily we denounce due to their beauty, and he is acceptable (Ja'iz) in Hadith.
353 - And Al-Furat bin Al-Sa'ib is close to Muhammad bin Ziyad Al-Tahhan regarding Maimun; he is accused of what that one is accused of.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
354 - And Al-Furat bin Salman is trustworthy (Thiqah), truthful (Saduq).
355 - And Abu Al-Malih is trustworthy, precise (Dabit) in his hadith, truthful. And to me, he is more precise than Ja'far bin Burqan. And Ja'far bin Burqan is trustworthy, precise in the hadith of Maimun and the hadith of Yazid bin Al-Asam, but regarding the hadith of Al-Zuhri, he is agitated and inconsistent in it.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
356 - And Asim bin Kulaib is trustworthy.
357 - And Asim bin Bahdalah is trustworthy. He mentioned him regarding Quran, righteousness, and virtue, and [said he is] good in Hadith. Al-A'mash is greater than him according to the Kufans.
358 - And Asim Al-Ahwal is among the Huffaz (preservers) of Hadith, trustworthy.
359 - And he said: Abdul-Wahhab is weak in Hadith, agitated (Mudtarib).
360 - And Ja'far bin Muhammad is weak in Hadith, agitated (Mudtarib).
361 - And his father, Abu Ja'far Muhammad bin Ali bin Husain, is trustworthy, strong in Hadith.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
362 - And Mujalid, from Al-Sha'bi and others, is weak in Hadith.
363 - And Zakariya, from Al-Sha'bi and others, is good in Hadith, trustworthy.
364 - And Alqamah bin Marthad used to be accused of Irja', and he was trustworthy in his hadith, precise (Dabit).
365 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Abu Abdullah said to me: When Ibn Mahdi mentioned Hammad bin Zaid, he would say: Our Sheikh, and our Sheikh was established in the Sunnah.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
Abu Abdullah said: And he did not have a book; his hadith was all from memory.
366 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And I heard Abu Abdullah say: Jarir said regarding the hadith of Al-A'mash: We used to stick them together.
367 - He said: Sulaiman bin Abi Muslim Al-Ahwal is trustworthy, good in Hadith, and Ibn Uyainah narrated from him.
368 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: He told me: And Yahya and Abdul-Rahman used not to narrate anything from Jabir Al-Ju'fi. Abu Abdullah said: And Jabir was deserving of that.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
369 - He said: And Abu Al-Zubayr is more pleasing to me in Hadith than Abu Sufyan Talhah bin Nafi'.
370 - And he said to me: Al-Aswad bin Shaiban was among the best worshippers of Allah. He used to say when they gathered around him: As for me, I have a need, I want to pray. He said: You know that there was no showing off in his heart.
371 - He said: And Malik was among the most established of people, yet he used to make mistakes.
372 - Abu Abdullah said: Al-Mas'udi is good in Hadith, and whoever took from him early on, then his taking is sound.
373 - And I asked him about Uqayl. He said: Good in Hadith, his narration is like the narration of

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
his companions; there is no harm in him.
374 - Ali bin Abi Talhah has denounced things, a man from the people of Homs.
375 - Ali bin Al-Mubarak, there is no harm in his hadith.
376 - Sulaiman bin Bilal is good in Hadith.
377 - Sharik bin Abi Namir is good in Hadith.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
378 - Al-Zubayr bin Abdullah, from Ja'far bin Mus'ab: We do not know either of them.
379 - Al-Miqdam bin Shuraih is trustworthy.
380 - Isra'il is good in Hadith.
381 - And Ash'ath bin Abi Al-Sha'tha' - and he is Ibn Sulaym, Al-Muharibi, and his father is

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
a man from the companions of Abdullah, good in Hadith.
382 - Abu Atiyah is trustworthy.
383 - Ibn Al-Asbahani is good in Hadith.
384 - Mujahid bin Wardan has a small amount [of hadith].
385 - Abu Al-Rijal, the companion of Amrah, is good in Hadith.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
386 - Muhammad bin Abdul-Rahman bin Zurarah is good in Hadith.
387 - Salim Al-Dawsi, I do not know.
388 - Muawiyah bin Salih, I know nothing but good [about him].
389 - Habib Al-Mu'allim is trustworthy.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
390 - Abu Al-Muhazzim Yazid: As for Shu'bah, he did not narrate from him, but Hammad bin Salamah narrated from him.
391 - And Abu Bakr bin Hafs is trustworthy.
392 - And Ibrahim bin Maimun, we do not know him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
393 - Talhah bin Yahya is good in Hadith.
394 - Yazid bin Ibrahim is trustworthy.
395 - Mughirah bin Ziyad, I do not know.
396 - And Usamah bin Zaid, the general public is upon him; they have narrated from him, except that Yahya bin Sa'id abandoned him.
397 - Ibrahim bin Al-Fadl, I do not know.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
398 - Dawud Al-Awdi is weak/feeble.
399 - Imran bin Hudair is trustworthy.
400 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And I heard him say: I have not seen anyone more knowledgeable about it than Yahya bin Sa'id, meaning the rituals (Manasik).
401 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I asked Khalaf: Did anyone refrain from Jabir Al-Ju'fi? He said: I do not know [anyone]. Sufyan bin Uyainah was among those strongest in speech

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
regarding him, yet he narrated from him. He only had three hadiths. I said: Is anything authentic from him that he believes in the Return (Raj'ah)? He said: No, but he was from the Shi'a of Ali. And Shu'bah, Al-Thawri, and the people narrate from him, except that these [scholars] do not narrate from him those things in which he combines Al-Qasim, Salim, and a group, like this, seven or eight [chains]. Indeed, for what would he narrate these things from him?
402 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Harun bin Ma'ruf say: I heard Abdullah bin Wahb say: Abdul-Rahman bin Mahdi said to me: Write for me from the hadiths of Amr. So I wrote two hundred hadiths for him, and I narrated them to him.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 403 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I said to Yahya bin Ma'in: The hadiths from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding the dislike of cupping for the fasting person, how are they interpreted? He said: They are all good. We said: So what about those who say: They are agitated (Mudtarib)? He said: I do not say that these hadiths are agitated.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
404 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Yahya saying: Muhammad bin Ishaq.
405 - We asked him about Abdul-Rahman bin Ishaq. He said: The Kufan? Weak.
406 - And Abdul-Rahman bin Ishaq Al-Basri, who narrates from Al-Zuhri, there is no harm in him.
407 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I said to Abu Zakariya Yahya: Ismail bin Zakariya, from Al-A'mash, from Habib bin Abi Thabit, from Sa'id bin

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: Jubayr, from Ibn Umar and Ibn Abbas, they both said: "If a man swears off his wife (Ayla), and four months pass, it is an irrevocable divorce." I said: Is the contrary narrated from them? He said: Yes, Sufyan and Shu'bah both narrate contrary to this, and this hadith is a mistake. I said: From whom did it come? He said: Ismail bin Zakariya, he is weak in hadith. I said: So did it come from him? [He said]: No, it is famous from Al-A'mash. I said: So did it come from Al-A'mash? He said: Yes, that is what I think, that it is from Al-A'mash.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
408 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Layth bin Abi Sulaim was mentioned. He said: Weak in hadith from Tawus; and if he combines Tawus and others with an addition, he is weak.
409 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Abu Abdullah bin Hanbal say: Marwan bin Shuja' told us. Abu Abdullah said: A truthful Sheikh.
410 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Al-Hisni told us, he said: Ma'qil told us, he said: I came to Muhammad bin Ishaq and heard him speaking about Qadar [free will heresy], so I did not return to him.
411 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And I heard him say: Mudrik bin Umarah is a known man. And he mentioned another man named Mudrik, and said: He is not known.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
412 - He said: They asked him about the hearing of Abu Salamah from his father. I heard him say: His father died while he was young. Abu Salamah was one of the youngest of them. Then he said: There is no one among the people [who has] more than Abu Salamah. I said: In the quantity of narration? He said: In the quantity of what he narrates. And he sat with Ibn Abbas. And he magnified the status of Abu Salamah that day.
413 - I heard Al-Maymuni say: Ahmad bin Hanbal was asked: Narrate to us the hadith of Abdul-Qais from Al-Qati'i. He said: Ask some of the scholars of Gharib (strange/uncommon words).

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
For I dislike speaking about the saying of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, based on conjecture and then making a mistake.
414 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And Abu Abdullah mentioned Za'idah, so he prioritized him and favored him in terms of firmness and precision.
415 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: They asked him: Who has the most regarding Ayyub? He said: I do not have anyone more knowledgeable about his hadith than Hammad - meaning Ibn Zaid - and he erred in several things.
416 - I heard Al-Maymuni say: And it was confirmed to me that he [Ahmad] did not attend [the funeral of] Abu Nasr Al-Tammar when he died. So I reckoned that was because he had answered during the Inquisition (Mihnah).

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 417 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal, and he was asked about the hadith of Abu Qais Al-Awdi, regarding what he narrated from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he wiped over the sandals and socks. He said to me: What is known from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, is that he wiped over the Khuffs [leather socks]. This is only from Abu Qais; indeed, he has denounced (Manakir) things.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text:
418 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Yahya told us, he said: Zuhair said: I saw Ash'ath bin Sawar standing at Abu Al-Zubayr's place, behind the people, and Abu Al-Zubayr was narrating. So Ash'ath would say: How did he say? And what did he say?
419 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Affan told us, he said: Mu'adh told us, he said: Ash'ath said: I never saw Hisham - meaning Ibn Hassan - with Al-Hasan ever. So it was said to him: Indeed Amr says this, so if you say it, you strengthen him against him, or [affirm] he told the truth or something like this. He said: I will not say this, and I will not return to this.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 420 - He said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Affan told us, he said: Mu'adh told us, he said: Humaid said to Al-Batti: "When people come to you, do you hold them to one opinion? No, but take from this and from that, and reconcile between them." He said: Al-Batti said: "I cannot bear your magic." Humaid was the peacemaker of the people of Basra. 421 - He said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Affan told us, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told me, he said: I used to ask Humaid about something from the legal rulings (Fatwa) of Al-Hasan, and he would say: "I have forgotten." 422 - He said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Ismail told us, he said: Abu Raja told us, he said: I said to Al-Hasan: "When was your last time in Medina?" He said: "The nights of Siffin." He said: I said: "So when did you leave?" He said: "After...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Siffin by a year." 423 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him—and he mentioned Abd al-Warith—so he said: He was older than Ismail bin Ulayyah by two years. He heard from more than one person that Ismail did not hear from. Then he mentioned the precision (Dabt) of Abd al-Warith, and that he was a man of grammar. Then he said: But he made mistakes in several things. Then he said: He narrated hadiths from Ayyub that none of his companions narrated, yet despite this, he is established (Thabt) and precise to him. 424 - He said: And I heard Abu Abd Allah Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Faith (Iman) is speech and action, it increases and decreases. They said to him: And intention? He said:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: Intention is a prerequisite in this context. 425 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Yahya—meaning Ibn Ayyub—told us, he said: I heard Humaid Al-Ru'asi say: When Zuhair heard a hadith from a narrator, he would write on it: "I have finished." 426 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Yahya told us, saying: I heard Shu'aib bin Harb—and he mentioned a hadith from Zuhair and Shu'bah—so Shu'bah was mentioned to him, and he said: Zuhair is more memorable [better at memorizing] than twenty like Shu'bah. 427 - He said: Yahya told us, he said: I heard Mu'adh bin Mu'adh say: No, by Allah, Sufyan was not more established to me than Zuhair.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 428 - He said: Yahya told us, he said: I heard Mu'adh bin Mu'adh say: If I heard the hadith from Zuhair, I did not care if I did not hear it from Sufyan. 429 - He said: Yahya told us, he said: I heard Aswad bin Salim say: I heard Hushaim say: We used to leave the session of Shu'bah because he would drag us into backbiting. 430 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Abu Abd Allah said to me one day: O Abu Al-Hasan, I liken the piety of your grandfather Maimun to the piety of Ibn Sirin. 431 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I asked Abu Abd Allah about Aflah bin Humaid. He said: Salih (righteous/good), acceptable. 432 - I said: Salamah bin Wardan? He said to me: The one who narrates from Anas?

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: I do not know what his Hadith is [like]; he has Munkar [denounced] things. 433 - I said: Dawud bin Qais Al-Farra? He said: Salih (good) in Hadith. 434 - I said: Muhammad bin Abd Allah, the nephew of Al-Zuhri? He said: He is also tolerated. 435 - I said: Usamah bin Zaid who narrates from Al-Qasim? He said: This one is also tolerated by the people, except that Yahya Al-Qattan abandoned him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 436 - Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Al-Mawwal? He said: I see no harm in his Hadith; he is among those who are tolerated. 437 - I said: Fa'id, the Mawla of Ubaid Allah? He said: This is the one whose Hadith people abandoned, Abu Al-Warqa; he is called the companion of Ibn Abi Awfa. 438 - I said: Hisham bin Sa'd Al-Khashab? He said: He is a man who is tolerated.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 439 - I said: Isa bin Asim? He said: Trustworthy (Thiqah). 440 - I said: Sa'id bin Muslim bin Banik? He said: I also think there is no harm in him. 441 - I said: Ibrahim bin Abd Allah bin Al-Harith Al-Jumahi? He said: I find myself knowing this one. 442 - I said: Sulaiman bin Abi Khalid, who narrates from his father? He said: I do not know him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 443 - I asked him about Umar bin Nabih Al-Ka'bi. He said: There is no harm in him. 444 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Abu Abd Allah said: Husain bin Waqid has Munkar things. 445 - I asked him about Abd Allah bin Sa'id bin Abi Hind. He said: Trustworthy (Thiqah). 446 - I asked him about Dawud bin Bakr bin Abi Al-Furat. He said: I do not know him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 447 - I asked him about Abd Allah bin Amir Al-Aslami, who narrates from Abu Al-Zubair. He said: He is not strong in Hadith. 448 - I asked him about Nafi' bin Jubair bin Mut'im. He said to me: A man from the children of the Companions, Trustworthy (Thiqah); I know only good [about him]. 449 - I asked him about Muhammad bin Amr, from Abu Salamah. He said to me: Perhaps he raised [to the Prophet] some Hadith, and perhaps he stopped short with it, and he is tolerated. Yahya bin Sa'id is more established in Hadith than him. 450 - I asked him about Abd Allah bin Dinar, from Ibn Umar. He said to me: Trustworthy (Thiqah), except one hadith he narrates from Ibn Umar, who said: "The Wala' (clientage) cannot be sold...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...nor gifted." And Nafi' said in the story of Barirah: "The Wala' belongs to the one who manumitted." 451 - I asked him about Kulaib bin Wa'il, who narrates from Ibn Umar. He said: I see no harm in him. 452 - I asked him about Amr bin Dinar regarding Ibn Abbas and Ibn Umar. He said: Among the Trustworthy ones (Al-Thiqat). He reports from Shu'bah that he said: I have not seen anyone more established than Amr bin Dinar.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 453 - I said to him: There are things he narrates as Mursal? He said: If he says "I heard" or "He told us." He used to narrate things from a man from Ibn Abbas. 454 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard Abu Abd Allah say: Abd Allah bin Zaid bin Aslam is more established than Abd al-Rahman. I said: More established? [About] Abd al-Rahman? He said: Like that; he is not like him, and he weakened his status a little. 455 - He said: I heard Abu Abd Allah say: Mahdi is Trustworthy. I said: Mahdi bin Maimun? He said: Yes, Trustworthy.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 456 - He said: I heard him say: Abd Allah bin Wahb Al-Masri was a righteous man. What [knowledge] he had of Hadith! I saw him—what a man! He praised him. Abu Abd Allah mentioned his leniency in taking [hadith]. I said to him: Are his Egyptian companions or most of his companions [like that] in leniency in taking? He said to me: Yes. 457 - I heard him say: Bishr bin Rafi', I do not see him as strong in Hadith. 458 - I heard him say: Haywah bin Shuraih is a righteous man, he has good things. And he added the saying of Ibn Al-Mubarak about him: "No one was described to me except that I saw him...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...less than what was described to me, except Haywah, for I saw him above what was described to me." 459 - I asked him about Abu Abd Allah Al-Shaqri. He said: He is not strong to me; he is weak. 460 - He mentioned Al-Walid bin Muslim and said: He was a man of leniency [Tasheel]. 461 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Khalid bin Khidash told us: Al-Darawardi, Ma'n, and the generality of the people of Medina said to me: Do not report from Abd al-Rahman bin Zaid bin Aslam, for he does not know what he is saying, but stick to Abd Allah bin Zaid.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 462 - I asked him about Ata' Al-Sulaimi. He said to me: This one is among the best of Allah's worshippers. He has no Hadith; it is only his opinion and his speech. 463 - And Salm Al-Alawi, he said to me: I only knew good [about him], but Shu'bah spoke against him. I said: Regarding the story of the new moon? He said to me: Yes.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 464 - I said: Al-Rabi' bin Sabih? He said to me: Physically [in person] he is a righteous man, but he does not possess Hadith that is needed; it is as if he weakened his status. 465 - I said: Hammad bin Abi Sulaiman? He said: As for the hadith of these Trustworthy ones (Thiqat) from him—Shu'bah, Sufyan, and Hisham—their hadiths are mostly close/consistent. However, he was the first to speak about Opinion (Ra'y). I said: Did he hold the view of Irja'? He said to me: Yes, he held the view of Irja'.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 466 - I said: Jabir Al-Ju'fi? He said to me: He held the view of Tashayyu' (Shi'ism). I said: Is he accused of lying in his Hadith? He said to me: Whoever attacked him only attacked him due to the fear of lying. I said: Lying? He said: Yes, by Allah, and that is evident in his Hadith when you look at it. 467 - I said: Hanzalah bin Abi Sufyan? He said to me: Trustworthy, Trustworthy, Al-Jumahi. 468 - I said: So Hanzalah Al-Sadusi? He said: He has Munkar (denounced) things. He narrated two hadiths, both of which are Munkar from the Prophet (peace be upon him) via Anas: that the Prophet (peace be upon him) performed Qunut in Witr, and the other: "He commanded us that when we meet, one should shake hands with his companion, and that we should bow to one another, and embrace one another." Both are Munkar.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 469 - I said: Yusuf Al-Majishun? He said to me: There is no harm in him, and we caught up with him. I said: You narrated from him, and he narrates from his father? He said: Yes. I said: And his father? He said: There is no harm in him. 470 - He mentioned Abd al-Aziz and said: He is the cousin of Yusuf. He mentioned good about him too. My greatest knowledge and understanding is that he mentioned a brother of Yusuf called Abd Allah, and he mentioned good about him as well.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 471 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: And he said—meaning Ahmad bin Hanbal—and he said to me: Yusuf lived a long life, so we met him. 472 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Abu Abd Allah said to me: Uthman bin Hakim is a Sheikh. I said: His hadiths? He said: They are close/consistent. 473 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: And they mentioned things from Mujalid, from Al-Sha'bi. He said: How many wonders [oddities] Mujalid has!

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 474 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: We discussed something one day, and they differed on it. A man said: Ibn Abi Shaybah says, from Affan. Abu Abd Allah said: Leave Ibn Abi Shaybah out of this; look at what others say. Abu Abd Allah meant his frequent mistakes. 475 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I said: Ismail bin Zakariyya, how is he? He said to me: As for the famous hadiths he narrates, he is close (Muqarib) in them, his Hadith is Salih (good), but the heart is not open to him; he is not known like this in the era of seeking [knowledge]. 476 - He said: I said to Abu Abd Allah: Al-Rabi' bin Sabih? He said: He does not have much that he supports [with chains]. He has things he narrates from Ata' and Al-Hasan, [regarding] issues,

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: and there is no harm in him. I said: A thing he narrates from Yazid? He said to me: He narrates it from Yazid from Anas regarding Raising [hands/voice]? I said: Yes. Abu Abd Allah smiled at me. I said: Do you remember it? What is in it from Yazid Al-Raqashi? He said to me: Yes. I said: And this Yazid is weak? He said: Yes, he is weak. 477 - Abu Abd Allah mentioned the hadith of Rawh from Ibn Abi Humaid. He said: If only it were someone other than Ibn Abi Humaid.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 478 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard Abu Al-Walid Hisham bin Abd Al-Malik say: Malik bin Anas had a bad opinion of Ibn Ishaq. 479 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Abu Abd Allah said: Ibn Jurayj was one of the vessels of knowledge. 480 - Abu Abd Allah said, and he mentioned Shu'aib Al-Jubba'i, he said: A man who read books, resembling Wahb.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 481 - Abu Abd Allah said to me: Rishdin, there is no harm in him regarding the Raqa'iq (heart-softening) hadiths. 482 - He said: Ibn Hanbal said: Ziyad bin Jubair bin Hayyah is a known man. 483 - He said: I do not know anyone who narrated from Abu Isa Al-Aswari other than Qatadah.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 484 - He said: Ibn Hanbal said: We do not find anyone who raises [marfu' - attributes to Prophet] other than Zuhair, meaning regarding the Muhrim (pilgrim) if he does not find his sandals. Zuhair was one of the mines of knowledge. 485 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Abu Abd Allah said to me regarding Yahya bin Sa'id in the hadith of Shu'bah: It is nothing from Mujahid. He said: I heard Aisha. He denied that he heard from Aisha. 486 - He said: Abu Abd Allah said: Ibn Abi Arubah did not hear from Yahya bin Sa'id, nor did Ma'mar hear anything from Yahya. Abu Abd Allah said that.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 487 - I heard him say: Bilal bin Sa'd is a righteous man. 488 - He said: I heard Abu Abd Allah say: Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman bin Ghunj is a Sheikh, close (Muqarib) in Hadith; Al-Layth narrates from him. 489 - He said: Abu Abd Allah mentioned Al-Sari bin Ismail, so he said: People abandoned his Hadith.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 490 - And Al-Mas'udi: whoever heard from him at the end [of his life], their hearing from him is criticized. 491 - A man asked him about Al-Hajjaj bin Artah, what is his status? He said: His status is that he adds to the hadiths. 492 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard my father say: Perhaps I saw Al-Hajjaj placing his hand on his head saying: The love of honor has killed me. 493 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: A man said to Abu Abd Allah: Ibn Abi Laila? He said: Weak. And Al-Hajjaj is greater in my soul [estimation] than him, except that he—meaning Ibn Abi Laila—in his hadith from Al-Minhal, it is as if he...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...a man said to him: Where does Mujalid stand compared to them? He said: This is a severe distinction. 494 - He said: Abd Allah said: So I wondered at him in that situation, how he used to answer him in such matters. Then he said to us: But he was a man who looked much into the narrators (Rijal) and speech (Kalam). Abu Abd Allah only mentioned Ibn Al-Mubarak in this story because he disliked answering them, but they informed him of the reward he would have in knowing this, so Ibn Al-Mubarak was mentioned at that time. 495 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Sa'id bin Bashir, I saw him weakening his status. I said: The one who narrates from Qatadah? He said: He narrated things from Qatadah. 496 - Muhammad bin Salamah Al-Harrani? He said: He is [strong] in his body, and I think he said: There is no harm in his Hadith. 497 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say: Ibn Abi Najih is Trustworthy (Thiqah), and was...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...his father was among the best of Allah's worshippers. 498 - Kathir bin Jamhan? He said: I do not know him well. 499 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say: Nothing is authentic for Hushaim from Al-Zuhri except four hadiths. 500 - And Ali bin Salih is Salih (good) in Hadith, but Al-Hasan bin Salih is his brother.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 501 - Al-Maimuni told us, Ahmad told us, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sa'id bin Al-Sa'ib told us, [he is] Hasan (good) in Hadith. 502 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say: Ibn Abi Labid is Established (Thabt) in Hadith. 503 - And Rabi'ah bin Abi Abd al-Rahman is Trustworthy (Thiqah).

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 504 - He said: I heard him say regarding Ghassan bin Mudar: How difficult [strict] of a Sheikh he was! 505 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: He said: We have not seen anyone more established in [narrating from] Ata' than Amr and Ibn Jurayj. 506 - He said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Yahya told us, Muthanna told us, he said: Qatadah told us. He said: Muthanna is Trustworthy (Thiqah). 507 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say: Abu Al-Zinad is among the Companions of Hadith.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 508 - And Ibn Ajlan is Trustworthy (Thiqah). And his father is Salih (good) in Hadith; he met Abu Hurairah. 509 - I heard him say: Umarah bin Al-Qa'qa' is Trustworthy (Thiqah). 510 - And Ishaq bin Suwaid is Established (Thabt). 511 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say, mentioning the Levantines (Shamiyyin): Sadaqah bin Khalid is Trustworthy (Thiqah), Trusted (Ma'mun). It has not reached me that any of...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...the Levantines writes his hadith with his own hand other than him; that is evident in his Hadith. 512 - And he mentioned Sadaqah Al-Samin, so he said: Weak. 513 - We discussed Salih bin Kaysan. I said to him: How is he? He said: Salih (Good/Righteous). 514 - He said: I heard him say: Amr bin Ubaid was not worthy that one narrates from him. [Ended] to here from Al-Maimuni.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 515 - Abu Awana Yaqub bin Ishaq told us, he said: Yazid bin Al-Mubarak Abu Khalid Al-Fasawi Al-Farisi told us, he said: Salamah bin Al-Fadl told us, he said: Abu Hamzah Al-Sukkari told us, from Sulaiman Al-Shaibani, from Abu Al-Ahwas, from Abd Allah bin Mas'ud, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "For Paradise, there is a gate called Al-Rayyan; the fasting ones enter it." 516 - And with his chain, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: "For the fasting person there are two joys: a joy when he breaks his fast, and a joy when he meets his Lord." 517 - Yaqub bin Sufyan Al-Farisi told us, from Yazid bin Al-Mubarak Abu Khalid, these two hadiths. They are among what our companions, the Memorizers (Huffaz) in Baghdad, asked me about. They are from the hadith of Al-Shaibani from Bayan. 518 - Yazid bin Al-Mubarak told us, he said: Salamah bin Al-Fadl told us, Abu Ja'far Al-Razi told us, from Ayyub Al-Sakhtiyani, from Abd Allah bin Abi Mulaikah, from Aisha, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Whatever the Faraq (a large measure) intoxicates, then a sip of it is Haram." 519 - Fadlak Al-Razi told us, and the people of Baghdad asked him about a Sheikh from the people of...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Rayy, from Salamah bin Al-Fadl, the like of it. 520 - Abu Awana said: This is a strange (Gharib) hadith from the hadith of Ayyub; I do not think anyone narrated it from Ayyub other than him. It is known from the hadith of Abu Uthman, from Al-Qasim, from Aisha. 521 - I asked Abu Yusuf Al-Farisi about Yazid bin Al-Mubarak. He said to me: He has been my neighbor for sixty years; I know him for uprightness and truthfulness. Yaqub [bin Sufyan] heard from him.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 522 - He said: I heard Muhammad bin Abd Allah bin Abd Al-Hakam say: Al-Shafi'i did not hold the view that anyone from Allah's creation should use the Kunya 'Abu Al-Qasim', neither Muhammad nor anyone else. 523 - He said: Al-Rabi' bin Sulaiman told us, he said: Ibn Wahb told us, he said: Malik bin Anas informed me, he said: Husain bin Rustum Al-Ayli was invited to a feast. He came, and he was fasting. When the food was placed, he did not eat. The host of the feast saw him and said: "Will you not eat?" He said: "I am fasting." He said: "What is upon you if you break your fast and fast a day in its place?" He said: "I promised Allah to fast this day, so I dislike breaking what I promised Him." 524 - Abu Ubaid Allah Mu'awiyah bin Salih Al-Dimashqi told us, he said:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: Ibrahim bin Abi Al-Abbas Al-Baghdadi—Trustworthy—told us, from Muhammad bin Himyar, from Bahir bin Sa'id, from Khalid bin Ma'dan, from Kathir bin Murrah, from Nu'aim bin Hammar, from Al-Miqdam bin Ma'dikarib, from Abu Ayyub, from Awf bin Malik, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) came out to us during the midday heat while he was terrified. He said: "Obey me as long as I am among you, and hold fast to the Book of Allah; make lawful what it allows and make unlawful what it forbids."

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 525 - He said: Abu Bakr Al-Ju'fi Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman told us in Damascus, he said: Junadah bin Muhammad Al-Murri told us, he said: Yahya bin Hamzah Al-Hadrami told me, from Al-Awza'i, from Laith bin Abi Sulaim, from Abu Al-Zubair, from Jabir, that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used not to sleep until he recited "Alif Lam Mim Tanzil" (The Prostration) and "Tabarak alladhi biyadihi al-mulk" (Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion).

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 526 - I heard Yunus bin Abd Al-A'la say: I heard Al-Shafi'i say: It was said to Umar bin Abd Al-Aziz: "What do you say regarding the people of Siffin?" He said: "That is blood from which Allah purified my hands, so I do not like to dye my tongue with it." 527 - I heard Yunus say: And Al-Shafi'i said to me: "Know that there is no way to be safe from [the criticism of] people, so look at what contains your best interest and stick to it."

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 528 - Muhammad bin Ya'qub Al-Ramli told us, Muhammad bin Ayyub bin Al-Mutawakkil told us, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Qattan and Ali bin Al-Madini told us, from Sufyan bin Uyainah, who said: Al-Hasan bin Muhammad said: "The best cloak you can wear is the cloak of forbearance (Hilm). It is, by Allah, better upon you than two hibarah (striped) garments. If you are not forbearing, then feign forbearance (Tahallam)." Muhammad said: I asked Ali bin Al-Madini, and he narrated it to me. 529 - Sa'id bin Amr Al-Sakuni told us, Baqiyyah told me, he said: And I heard Al-Mu'tamir, from Ibn Jurayj, from Al-Zuhri, from Al-Miswar bin Makhramah, from Abd Allah bin Amr, that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him): forbade the Jummah (letting hair hang down) for the free woman, and the Aqsah (tying hair in a bun) for the slave woman.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 530 - Humaid bin Ayyash told us, he said: Mu'ammal bin Ismail told us, Hammad bin Salamah told us, from Suhail, from his brother, from his father, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "Whoever remembers Allah Almighty frequently is absolved of hypocrisy." 531 - Nasr bin Marzuq told us, Ismail bin Maslamah Al-Qa'nabi told us, he said: I saw Al-Hasan bin Abi Ja'far in a dream after he died.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: in Abadan, so he said to me: Ayyub, Yunus, and Ibn Awn are in Paradise. He said: So I said: What about Amr bin Ubaid? He said: In the Fire. Ismail said: Then I saw Al-Hasan bin Abi Ja'far in a dream, and he said: Ayyub, Yunus, and Ibn Awn are in Paradise. Ismail said: What about Amr bin Ubaid? He said: In the Fire, how many times must I tell you? 532 - Ja'far bin Abdul-Wahid Al-Hashimi told me, Muhammad bin Abbad Al-Huna'i told us, from Shu'bah, from Qatadah, from Al-Sha'bi, from Ibn Abbas, that the Prophet (peace be upon him) prayed over a grave after [the person] was buried. Shu'bah said: So I said to Qatadah: From whom did you hear it? He said: Asim told me

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: bin Bahdalah [told me]. Shu'bah said: So I asked Asim bin Bahdalah: From whom did you hear it? He said: Al-Shaibani told it to me. Shu'bah said: So I met Al-Shaibani and asked him: From whom did you hear it? He said: Al-Sha'bi told me from Ibn Abbas that the Prophet (peace be upon him) prayed over a grave. 533 - Abu Ja'far Muhammad bin Al-Hajjaj Al-Hadrami, an Egyptian, told us, he said: Al-Khasib bin Nasih told us, he said: Sufyan bin Uyainah told us, from Abdullah bin Dawud, from Al-A'mash, from Dharr, from Yusai',

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: from Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "{Indeed, those who disdain My worship}" [Ghafir: 60], he said: Meaning 'My supplication', "{will enter Hell rendered contemptible}." 534 - Al-Abbas bin Al-Walid informed me, he said: Abu Mushir told us, he said: I heard Malik bin Anas say: It is part of the removal of knowledge that you answer everyone who asks you. 535 - He said: I read to Abu Salamah Al-Muslim bin Muhammad Al-Hamdani in Sana'a, and he also informed me, he said: Abdul-Malik bin Abdul-Rahman Abu Hisham Al-Dhimari informed me, from Sufyan Al-Thawri, from Malik bin Anas, from Abdullah bin Al-Fadl, from Nafi' bin Jubayr bin Mut'im, from Ibn Abbas, that

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The previously married woman has more right to herself than her guardian, and the virgin is asked for permission, and her permission is her silence." 536 - He said: I heard Al-Uzzi say: I heard Al-Firyabi say: I heard Al-Thawri say: The departure of the believer from the world is exactly like the exit of a child from the womb; he exits into comfort from distress. 537 - I heard Abu Umayyah say: I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal praising Al-Asma'i regarding the Sunnah,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: he said: And I heard Ali bin Al-Madini praising him. 538 - I heard Yazid bin Abdul-Samad say: I asked Yahya bin Ma'in about Khalid bin Abdul-Rahman, and he said: Trustworthy. 539 - Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Abi Bakr Al-Muqaddami told us, he said: I heard Ali bin Al-Madini in the year two hundred and twenty, and Sulaiman bin Harb was mentioned to him, so he began to speak highly of him. He said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us thirty years ago, he said: Sulaiman bin Harb told me, from Hammad bin Zaid, he said: The thing I fear most for Ayyub and Ibn Awn is nothing but Hadith. 540 - Ahmad bin Isam told us, he said: Abu Bakr Al-Hanafi told us,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: he said: Sufyan Al-Thawri told us, from Abu Al-Zubayr, from Jabir, he said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "It does not harm the menstruating woman or the person in a state of major impurity (Junub) not to undo her hair if the water reaches the roots of her hair." 541 - Muslim bin Al-Hajjaj told us, he said: Malik bin Abdul-Wahid Abu Ghassan Al-Misma'i told us, he said: Mu'adh told us, he said: My father told us, from Matar, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Aisha, she said: We were in the Hajj of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him); some of us assumed Ihram for Hajj, and some of us assumed Ihram for Umrah, and I was among those who assumed Ihram for Umrah. 542 - Sa'id bin Abdul-Rahman bin Abdullah bin Daduwayh told us, he said:

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: I read to my father, from Rabah, from Ma'mar, from Ibn Jurayj, from Abdul-Aziz bin Umar bin Abdul-Aziz, from Al-Rabi' bin Sabrah, from his father, that he said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said on the day of the Farewell Pilgrimage, a day before the Day of Tarwiyah: "Whoever would like to engage in Mut'ah (temporary marriage) in the manner of marriage for a known term, let him do so," and he mentioned the hadith. Then, when it was the Day of Tarwiyah, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Indeed, I had permitted Mut'ah marriage for you, so whoever has married in that manner, it is invalid. And indeed, I have forbidden it, so it is forbidden until the Day of Resurrection." 543 - Hamdan bin Musa, Abu Sa'id Al-Balkhi, told us, he said: It was told to us

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: by Isam bin Yusuf, he said: Warqa' told us, from Amr bin Dinar, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas, from the Prophet (peace be upon him), that he said: "When it is the Day of Resurrection, the slain comes with the killer, holding his head in his hand, grasping his forelock, his jugular veins gushing blood, so he brings him close to the Throne." Then Ibn Abbas mentioned repentance, and he recited this verse: "{But whoever kills a believer intentionally - his recompense is Hell, wherein he will abide eternally, and Allah has become angry with him and has cursed him and has prepared for him a great punishment}" [An-Nisa: 93]. By Allah, it has not been abrogated since it was revealed, so how can there be repentance for him? 544 - Ubaid bin Muhammad Al-Kushuri told us, he said: I asked Abu Mus'ab about Ibn Sam'an, and he said: He was suspect/weak (Murammada).

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: And I asked Yahya bin Ma'in, and he said: He was a liar. 545 - I heard Abbas Al-Duri say: I heard Yahya bin Ma'in say: Jabir Al-Ju'fi, his hadith is not written, and no honor [is due to him]. 546 - Ahmad bin Yahya Al-Sabari told us, he said: Ahmad bin Abi Taibah told us, from Warqa', from Mansur, from a man from the people of Basra, from Qatadah, from Anas, that the Prophet (peace be upon him) freed Safiyyah bint Huyayy, and made her manumission her dowry, and he held a wedding feast for them with Hais (a mixture of dates, butter, and cheese) on a leather mat.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 547 - Attiyah bin Baqiyyah bin Al-Walid Al-Himsi told us, he said: My father told me, from Zaid bin Waqid, from Busr bin Ubaidullah, from Yazid bin Khumayr, he said: I heard Awf bin Malik say: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: "The storytellers/preachers are three: a ruler, or one commanded [by a ruler], or a show-off." 548 - Zakariya bin Yahya told us, he said: Ibn Uyainah told us, from Sulaiman

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: bin Muslim Al-Ahwal, he said: We were in Mecca and Miqsam was with us, and I was with Tawus. Miqsam began to talk to him, and Tawus kept saying: "He is Miqsam." He said: So I said: "O Abu Abdul-Rahman, [call him] Abu Al-Qasim?" He said: "By Allah, I will never call him by that Kunya (nickname)." 549 - Muhammad bin Amir told us, he said: Muhammad bin Isa told us, he said: Al-Qasim bin Musa told us, from Al-Awza'i, from Umar bin Abdullah bin

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: Abi Talhah, from Anas bin Malik, he said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Every intoxicant is forbidden." 550 - Muslim bin Al-Hajjaj told us, he said: Abu Ghassan Al-Misma'i told me, he said: Mu'adh bin Hisham told us, he said: My father told me, from Matar, from Sa'd bin Hisham, from Aisha, that the Prophet of Allah (peace be upon him) used to pray four [rak'ahs] before Dhuhr. 551 - He said: I heard Al-Muzani say: I heard Al-Shafi'i say: There is not

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: a people who do not bring out their women to men other than themselves [i.e., marry outside the tribe/family], except that their children come out foolish. 552 - Abu Ubaidah, the nephew of Hannad, told us, he said: Uthman bin Zufar told us, he said: Hibban bin Ali told us, from Ibn Shubrumah, he said: Men have not worn clothing more adorning than Arabic [clothing/language/manners]. 553 - Zakariya bin Yahya Al-Basri told me, he said: I heard Al-Asma'i

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: say: On the ring of Abu Amr bin Al-Ala [was inscribed]: "Indeed, a man whose worldly life is his greatest concern is holding onto a cord of delusion from it." 554 - Abdullah bin Muhammad Al-Qurashi told us, he said: Abdul-Rahman bin Salih told us, he said: Abu Tumailah told us, from Abu Ghanim, from Abu Sahl Kathir

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: bin Ziyad. "{And your clothing purify}" [Al-Muddaththir: 4], he said: [Meaning] Your character, so improve it. 555 - Wuhaib bin Yazid told us, he said: Damrah told us, from Raja' bin Abi Salamah, he said: Khalid bin Yazid bin Muawiyah said: I leave much speech for fear of the response. 556 - Zakariya bin Yahya Al-Basri told us, he said: Umm Muhammad told us

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: Al-Habatiyyah, he said: The clan of Rabi'ah [Al-Adawiyyah] said to her: Speak to the Amir so he might buy a house for your clan to shelter in. She said: By Allah, I am ashamed to ask for the world from the One who owns it [Allah], so how can I ask for it from one who does not own it? 557 - Ja'far bin Muhammad bin Nuh Al-Adhani told us, he said: Muhammad bin Isa told us, from Malik bin Anas, from Yahya bin Sa'id, from Muhammad bin Yahya bin Hibban, "That his wife Fatimah reproached him regarding the infrequency of his intimate relations with her, so he said to her: Between me and you is the judgment of Umar bin Al-Khattab,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: so I said: And what is the judgment of Umar? He said: Once in every period of purity. She said: The judgment of Umar has been abandoned in this matter, so how can I and you accept it?" 558 - Ahmad bin Abdul-Rahman told us, he said: I heard Al-Asma'i say: Abu Amr bin Al-Ala informed me, he said: Never did two men revile each other except that the more vile of the two overcame. 559 - Al-Abbas bin Muhammad told us, he said: Qurad Abu Nuh told us, he said: I heard Ismail bin Ulayyah say: I heard Yunus bin Ubaid say: When Sa'id bin Abi Al-Hasan, the brother of Al-Hasan Al-Basri, died,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: Al-Hasan's grief and weeping over him was prolonged. So we said to him: You are an Imam among the Imams, people follow your example; if only you would leave some of what you are doing [i.e., reduce your grief]. He said: Leave me be, for I have not seen Allah Almighty fault Jacob for the length of his grief over Joseph. So this only increased him in grief and weeping. 560 - Zakariya bin Yahya told us, he said: Al-Asma'i told us, he said: Hisham bin Al-Hakam Al-Thaqafi told me, he said: It used to be said: Five things are ugly in a man: Youthfulness [acting childishly] in old men, greed is the illness of the Qur'an readers/scholars, lack of modesty in those of noble lineage, miserliness in the wealthy, and sharpness [anger/hastiness] in the ruler. 561 - Al-Asma'i said: A Bedouin said to his son: O my son, indeed the one who wins through evil is the defeated one.

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 562 - Abu Al-Kurush Muhammad bin Amr bin Tammam told us, he said: I heard Nu'aym bin Hammad say: I heard Hushaim say: I heard [hadiths] from Abu Al-Zubayr, then Shu'bah took it [the writings] and tore it up. 563 - Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Abi Raja' Al-Massisi told us, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Ubayy Abdullah Al-Shami told us, he said: I asked for permission to enter upon Tawus to ask him about an issue. An old man came out to me, and I thought he was Tawus. He said: I said: Are you Tawus? He said: I am his son. I said: If you are his son, then your father has become senile. He said: He says to me: "The scholar does not become senile." He said: So he asked permission for me to enter upon him, so I entered upon him,

book_title: The Collection regarding Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: and Tawus said to me: Ask and be brief. And if you wish, I will teach you in this sitting of yours the Qur'an, the Torah, and the Gospel. He said: I said: If you teach me the Torah and the Gospel, I will not ask you about anything else. He said: Fear Allah with a fear such that nothing is more feared by you than Him, and hope in Him with a hope that is stronger than your fear of Him, and love for people what you love for yourself. 564 - He said: Sa'dan bin Yazid told us, he said: Hunaid told us, he said: Hajjaj told us, from Uqbah bin Sinan, Aktham bin Saifi said: The arrogant one has no share in good praise.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 565 - Muhammad bin Abd al-Malik Al-Daqiqi told us, he said: I heard Affan bin Muslim narrating from Hammad bin Salamah, he said: Thabit said: "O Allah, if You have granted anyone prayer in his grave, then grant me prayer in my grave." 566 - Al-San'ani told us, he said: Abd al-Samad bin Hassan told us, he said: I saw Sufyan Al-Thawri in Makkah drinking castor oil [or a specific medicinal drink] with honey, and he had retracted his opinion regarding Nabidh [fermented drink].

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 567 - Ibn Al-Farhi told us, from Abu Khaithamah, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id was asked about drinking Nabidh, so he said: I heard Sulaiman Al-Taymi say: "It is not befitting for a Muslim man to risk his religion regarding his drinking." 568 - Al-Husain bin Yazid Al-Qurashi told me, he said: Ibn Al-Mughirah Al-Kufi told us, he said: I heard Sufyan Al-Thawri say: "Be content in soul with solitude, and accept loneliness as companionship; I have not found among people anyone who is worth a fals [penny] upon testing." 569 - Ishaq bin Al-Jarrah told us, he said: I heard Yazid bin Harun saying to Harun Al-Mustamli: "O Allah, do not make us burdensome." 570 - I heard Muhammad bin Ismail Al-Sa'igh say: I heard Yazid bin Harun say: "Changing [the Sunnah] is an innovation (Bid'ah) and misguidance."

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 571 - Mada' Abu Al-Rida told me, from Ahmad bin Khalid Al-Khallal, he said: A man wrote to another regarding a need, but he put him off. So he wrote to him: "O my brother, a beautiful excuse is better than long procrastination. If our need is ready, then facilitate [success]; and if it is impossible, then clarify." 572 - Ibrahim bin Al-Husain Al-Kisa'i told us, he said: Musaddad told us, he said: Umayyah bin Khalid told us, he said: Tasnim bin Al-Hawari told me, he said: Qatadah told us, he said: We entered upon a woman and she began reciting: "A man prays for safety and long life, yet it might harm him..."

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...His cheerfulness vanishes, and after the sweetness of life, its bitterness remains. And regrets follow successively until he sees nothing that pleases him. How many rejoice at my misfortune if I perish, saying: 'To Allah is attributed his goodness' [or praising his death]." 573 - Abu Dawud Al-Harrani told us, he said: Abu Attab told us, he said: I heard Sa'id bin Abi Arubah saying: "I indeed love to be called: This is an Uthmani [supporter of Uthman]." 574 - Abu Hatim told us, he said: Abd al-Wahhab bin Qurrah told us...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Al-Wasiti, from Hushaim, he said: I said to Amr bin Ubaid: "Describe Al-Hasan to me." He said: "When I saw him, it was as if he came from burying his mother. When he sat, he sat like a prisoner about to be beheaded. And when he spoke, he spoke the speech of a man who had been ordered to the Fire." 575 - Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Abi Al-Jahim Al-Basri told us, he said: Abu Umar Al-Hawdi told us, he said: Shu'bah, when he finished [narrating] Hadith, would say: "The bowstring has snapped. May Allah send blessings upon Muhammad." 576 - Ibn Abi Al-Jahim told us, he said: Nasr bin Ali told us, he said: Abu Dawud told us, from Shu'bah, he said: Uthman Al-Barri benefitted me [with a hadith]. He narrated to us from Qatadah. So I came to Qatadah and asked him about it, and he said: "I did not narrate it to him."

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: So we gathered at Qatadah's. Uthman said to him: "You narrated such-and-such hadith to me." He said: "I never narrated it to you." He said: "Yes, you narrated it to me." Qatadah said to Uthman: "Do you know what emboldened you against me? You have two hundred dirhams [debt] against me." 577 - Abbas Al-Duri told us, he said: Ismail bin Dawud Al-Jazari told us, he said: Yahya bin Matar told us, from Hammad bin Salamah, he said: I entered upon Iyas bin Mu'awiyah while he was eating Faludhaj [a sweet dish]. He said to me: "Come, eat, for it increases intellect." I said to Yahya bin Matar: "How often does a man feed his family Faludhaj?" He said: "Every Friday." 578 - Al-Saghani told us, he said: I heard Abu Al-Nadr say:...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Sufyan was the exposer of the Reciters [showy worshippers]. 579 - Al-Saghani told us, he said: Ubaid Allah bin Aisha told us, he said: Hammad bin Salamah told us, from Thabit, that Amir bin Abd Allah said to two cousins of his: "Entrust your affairs to Allah, you will be at ease." 580 - Abu Hubairah Muhammad bin Al-Walid Al-Qalanisi Al-Dimashqi, Mawla of Banu Hashim, told us, he said: Abu Ayyub Sulaiman bin Shurahbil told us, he said:...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Abu Khulaid Al-Qari Utbah bin Hammad told us, he said: Al-Awza'i told us, he said: Abd Allah bin Ali sent for me. This weighed heavily on me and was difficult for me. He said: So I came to him. He said: I entered, and the people were in two rows... standing; in front of them was the Kafir [executioner] with clubs/weapons. He said: He brought me near, then asked me. He said: "O Abd al-Rahman, what do you say about this exit [revolt/campaign] of ours and what we are in?" He said: I said: "May Allah rectify the Emir." He said: "There was friendship between me and Dawud bin Ali." He said:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: "You must tell me." He said: I thought, then I said: "By Allah, I will tell him the truth." He said: And I resigned myself to death. I said: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Ansari told me, from Muhammad bin Ibrahim, from Al-Qamah bin Waqqas, he said: I heard Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, say: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Actions are but by intention, and every man shall have but what he intended. Thus, he whose migration was for Allah and His Messenger, his migration was for Allah and His Messenger; and he whose migration was for some worldly benefit he would gain or a woman he would marry, his migration was for that to which he migrated." He said: And in his hand was a stick with which he was scratching the ground. Then he said: "O Abd al-Rahman, what do you say about killing the people of this House [Umayyads]?" He said: A grave matter came upon me, and I resigned myself to Allah Almighty. He said: I said: "By Allah, I will tell him the truth." He said: Then I said: "May Allah rectify the Emir, there was friendship between me and your brother Dawud." He said: "Come on, tell me." He said: I said: Marwan told me, from Mutarrif bin Al-Shikhkhir, from Aisha, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said:

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: "It is not lawful to kill a Muslim except in three cases: The one who abandons his religion, or a man who killed a soul so he is killed [in retaliation], or a man who committed adultery after being married (Muhsan)." He said: Then he lowered his head while standing. He said: "Tell me about the Caliphate, is it a bequest for us from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)?" He said: A grave matter came upon me, and I resigned myself to death, and said: "I will tell him the truth." I said: "May Allah rectify the Emir, there was friendship between me and Dawud bin Ali." He said: "You must tell me." Then I said: "If it were a bequest from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), Ali bin Abi Talib would not have let anyone precede him." Then he remained silent for a while. Then he said: "What do you say about the wealth of Banu Umayyah? Is it Halal for us?" He said: I resigned myself to death and said: "I will tell him the truth." I said: "May Allah rectify the Emir, there was friendship between me and Dawud." He said: "You must tell me." He said: So I said to him: "If it was Halal for them, then it is Haram for you. And if it was Haram for them, then it is even more Haram for you." He said: Then he ordered me to be taken out.

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: 581 - Muhammad bin Ahmad Al-Basri told us, from Ibrahim bin Muhammad, he said: I heard Sufyan bin Uyainah say: The Angel of Death entered upon Dawud. He said: "Who are you?" He said: "I am the one who does not fear kings, nor do palaces prevent him, nor does he accept bribes." 582 - Ahmad bin Sa'd Abu Ibrahim Al-Zuhri told us, he said: Khalaj bin Hadh'a told us, he said: Mu'alla bin Hilal Al-Warraq told us, from Malik...

book_title: The Comprehensive [Book] on Defects and Knowledge of Men by Ahmad bin Hanbal
text: ...Ibn Dinar, he said: I entered upon a neighbor of mine while he was sick. I said: "Covenant with Allah Almighty that you will repent, perhaps He will cure you." He said: "Far from it, O Abu Yahya. I am dead. I tried to make a covenant just as I used to make covenants [and break them], but I heard a speaker from the corner of the house saying: 'We made covenants with you multiple times, but we found you to be a liar.'" 583 - Ahmad bin Uthman Al-Awdi told us, he said: Qasim bin Qais Al-Nakha'i told us, he said: Humaid bin Al-Muthanna told us, from Abu Ja'far, he said: "If the stomach is full, the body transgresses."
